commit_message:
Add helper method _drop_all_ip_traffic_to_port and tests

This patch simply pulls out some code from _add_acl to a helper method.
I'm starting to go through and add test coverage for the acl methods in
the plugin. Eventually my goal is to pull out all the acl helper methods
to their own class and file outside of the plugin.

Change-Id: If9fb28c7c7a0e23851d81db3ce241a0158d1d703

subject: Do not assume galera_all hostgroup exists in galera_server role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-09 11:15:13.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Do not assume galera_all hostgroup exists in galera_server role

The 'main.yml' task file found in the 'galera_server' role assumes
the 'galera_all' hostgroup exists. It uses it as a condition to run
the 'galera_setup.yml' task file which is used to initialize
the Galera cluster. This assumptions could prevent someone from reusing
the 'galera_server' role independently.

The 'galera_server_bootstrap_node' variable exists and defaults to
groups['galera_all'][0].

This change suggests using the 'galera_server_bootstrap_node' variable
so someone could override its value without the need to patch
the 'main.yml' task file.

Change-Id: I8e810b0cdd3425c9782280c4ff1f59526dd96c0b
(cherry picked from commit 40f25b16be4813451bdf8580d923a06b74b22f17)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not assume galera_all hostgroup exists in galera_server role

The 'main.yml' task file found in the 'galera_server' role assumes
the 'galera_all' hostgroup exists. It uses it as a condition to run
the 'galera_setup.yml' task file which is used to initialize
the Galera cluster. This assumptions could prevent someone from reusing
the 'galera_server' role independently.

The 'galera_server_bootstrap_node' variable exists and defaults to
groups['galera_all'][0].

This change suggests using the 'galera_server_bootstrap_node' variable
so someone could override its value without the need to patch
the 'main.yml' task file.

Change-Id: I8e810b0cdd3425c9782280c4ff1f59526dd96c0b
(cherry picked from commit 40f25b16be4813451bdf8580d923a06b74b22f17)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-04 09:40:38.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_util_node.py', 'octane/util/node.py', 'octane/magic_consts.py'], 'message': 'Add functions to set/unset upgrade_levels for compute service

These functions set and unset upgrade_levels for the compute service
in nova.conf file. It will be used to handle rolling upgrade of compute
nodes as well as the cleanup of nova.conf once upgrade is finished.

Related-bug: #1506041
Co-Authored-By: Ilya Kharin <akscram@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4fcefae2051221ad220c0cb70226083060c5aa23

commit_message:
Add functions to set/unset upgrade_levels for compute service

These functions set and unset upgrade_levels for the compute service
in nova.conf file. It will be used to handle rolling upgrade of compute
nodes as well as the cleanup of nova.conf once upgrade is finished.

Related-bug: #1506041
Co-Authored-By: Ilya Kharin <akscram@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4fcefae2051221ad220c0cb70226083060c5aa23

Earlier, quotas used to authenticate to endpoint from not required
option located in keymgr.encryption_auth_url. Now, the required
auth_uri option from config file is used to authenticate to
keystone.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>
Change-Id: I1076527704f8def2c6755c060df49232e5ebe805
Closes-Bug: 1516085

commit_message:
Use proper config option to connect to keystone

Earlier, quotas used to authenticate to endpoint from not required
option located in keymgr.encryption_auth_url. Now, the required
auth_uri option from config file is used to authenticate to
keystone.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>
Change-Id: I1076527704f8def2c6755c060df49232e5ebe805
Closes-Bug: 1516085

commit_message:
Use node util functions to manage upgrade_levels

'add_compute_upgrade_levels'.

'cleanup' command.

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I2625f9689d72ea68f8daa1b5e442a75b50fbfa52
Closes-bug: #1524824

commit_message:
Convert xenapi driver to using up/down vhd2

Now that the glance xen plugin supports vhd2 urls we can consume them
in the glance xenapi driver, this moves all our communication to dom0
to be using glance urls instead of the port / host / use_ssl tuple
that we previously had.

All unit test converted to use this new functionality.

Change-Id: Ib4f8a8f8b7d83acb03fd7afbc205795e6af5940f

subject: Ensures plan exists
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-10 14:40:11.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/core/test_plan.py', 'tripleo_common/core/plan.py', 'tripleo_common/core/exception.py'], 'message': "Ensures plan exists

In the current PlanManager,  PlanDoesNotExistError is only raised
when you try to delete a plan that doesn't exist.  This patch adds
the check to ensure a plan exists to the read and update operations
as well and fixes a small bug in the PlanDoesNotExistError message
and its usage.

Change-Id: Ibf6e37ee70876a23ea220a745dd7c63f73ae0fdb
"}]
commit_message:
Ensures plan exists

In the current PlanManager,  PlanDoesNotExistError is only raised
when you try to delete a plan that doesn't exist.  This patch adds
the check to ensure a plan exists to the read and update operations
as well and fixes a small bug in the PlanDoesNotExistError message
and its usage.

Change-Id: Ibf6e37ee70876a23ea220a745dd7c63f73ae0fdb

subject: Block oslo.messaging 3.1.0 since it breaks Ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 19:30:20.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Block oslo.messaging 3.1.0 since it breaks Ironic

oslo.messaging change I21d76abf1c30b9e89cb8a6c20d1c0cc79cd83a3f was
released in 3.1.0 and due to debtcollector bug 1520397 it breaks Ironic
loading it's request context serializer.

That was worked around in Ironic on master (mitaka) in commit
37d36f1536944de38a0f7a726e625b893088e1be but that doesn't fix Ironic in
stable/liberty, and we aren't going to backport that workaround to
stable/liberty.

So we need to fix oslo.messaging (either revert the deprecation change
or remove the usage of debtcollector) and release a fix there to fix
stable/liberty, but we still have to block the broken 3.1.0 release.

Related-Bug: #1524041

Conflicts:
        global-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I3c5a9851ada30b6d7470113014b542b550a4ae8b
(cherry picked from commit 36151438e823de344a0288b8caa3a47586f44ceb)
"}]
commit_message:
Block oslo.messaging 3.1.0 since it breaks Ironic

oslo.messaging change I21d76abf1c30b9e89cb8a6c20d1c0cc79cd83a3f was
released in 3.1.0 and due to debtcollector bug 1520397 it breaks Ironic
loading it's request context serializer.

That was worked around in Ironic on master (mitaka) in commit
37d36f1536944de38a0f7a726e625b893088e1be but that doesn't fix Ironic in
stable/liberty, and we aren't going to backport that workaround to
stable/liberty.

So we need to fix oslo.messaging (either revert the deprecation change
or remove the usage of debtcollector) and release a fix there to fix
stable/liberty, but we still have to block the broken 3.1.0 release.

Related-Bug: #1524041

Conflicts:
        global-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I3c5a9851ada30b6d7470113014b542b550a4ae8b
(cherry picked from commit 36151438e823de344a0288b8caa3a47586f44ceb)

commit_message:
Expose project_id in octavia api

The project_id (formerly tenant_id) was not actually allowed as an
attribute of any entity on create nor would it be returned as details
of an entity.  project_id will be used in the future and is just
overall good to have.

This also accepts request headers to set the project_id if they are passed in
and no tenant_id is provided in the body.

Change-Id: I6408b7863409870b502de03af35692b065b2c6dc

commit_message:
Send project_id/tenant_id to octavia api

Octavia will need to know the project_id of each entity that gets
created, so neutron-lbaas should send the tenant_id as the project_id
to octavia.

Change-Id: Ic5f5344d0dae23828c2b1b6ecf435aad05905676
Depends-On: I6408b7863409870b502de03af35692b065b2c6dc
Closes-Bug: #1522652

commit_message:
Rename Mapper to Mapping

Some Python class and packages need to be renamed
for a better compliance with the shared terminology
which provides a better understanding of Watcher
objects and components by every contributor.

This patchset is there to change mapper to mapping

Partially implements: blueprint glossary-related-refactoring

Change-Id: Ieaca42431322ce40d87de147ac0b46a1f446f390

subject: Add unit test for TestServerList to test --long option.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 16:50:22.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Add unit test for TestServerList to test --long option.

In two steps:
1. Setup all necessary attributes of a server in setUp(), including
   the ones that are not faked in FaseServer by default.
2. Run a similar process with no option test case.

The future plan is to move all these attributes to FakeServer.
But it will cause some other changes which has nothing to do with
this patch. So leave this job to do later.

Change-Id: I1134812a0ea146ef737b0f0ffbef8ca23684accd
Implements: blueprint osc-unit-test-framework-improvement
'}]
commit_message:
Add unit test for TestServerList to test --long option.

In two steps:
1. Setup all necessary attributes of a server in setUp(), including
   the ones that are not faked in FaseServer by default.
2. Run a similar process with no option test case.

The future plan is to move all these attributes to FakeServer.
But it will cause some other changes which has nothing to do with
this patch. So leave this job to do later.

Change-Id: I1134812a0ea146ef737b0f0ffbef8ca23684accd
Implements: blueprint osc-unit-test-framework-improvement

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-09 17:05:22.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/templates/dnsmasq.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/README.md'], 'message': "Fix dhcp range for static inventory

For static inventory, we need to define dhcp range, but
we need to provide the static flag. If we don't add the flag, and
there are more NICs attached to that network, dnsmasq will continue
providing dynamic ips on that range, causing the nodes expecting
this one to fail because the ip is already assigned.
Also, set the lease time to infinite, as we have static assignment
on that case, so no need to renew.

Change-Id: I6c0e5a3974900a4e71608e7e6c2c3fcfd1c69463
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dhcp range for static inventory

For static inventory, we need to define dhcp range, but
we need to provide the static flag. If we don't add the flag, and
there are more NICs attached to that network, dnsmasq will continue
providing dynamic ips on that range, causing the nodes expecting
this one to fail because the ip is already assigned.
Also, set the lease time to infinite, as we have static assignment
on that case, so no need to renew.

Change-Id: I6c0e5a3974900a4e71608e7e6c2c3fcfd1c69463

commit_message:
Keystone domain fix

The keystone module is not able to function when using Keystone
and the multi-domain backend. This issue is caused because the
domain argument is not passed into the client calls. to resolve
this issue the module has been updated to pass through the domain
to the various client calls where needed

Closes-Bug: #1518351
Closes-Bug: #1519174
Change-Id: Ie19f1658d770cc421e23ebb59e658624cf668840
Co-Authored-By: Tiago Gomes <tiago.gomes@codethink.co.uk>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Ability to define the mtu globally (for all the container networks)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-08 16:57:24.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/templates/container-interface.ini.j2'], 'message': 'Ability to define the mtu globally (for all the container networks)

Currently, deployers can override MTUs on a per-network basis,
but may be looking for a way to define the mtu globally.

This implements a variable named ``lxc_container_default_mtu``
that currently defaults to 1500 (standard value). If this variable
is set, it will globally override the mtu, while still keeping the
per-network override.

Change-Id: Ia7e4f9e929f513ddc09e6de9467ec6ff765e2e6f
Closes-Bug: #1518311'}]
commit_message:
Ability to define the mtu globally (for all the container networks)

Currently, deployers can override MTUs on a per-network basis,
but may be looking for a way to define the mtu globally.

This implements a variable named ``lxc_container_default_mtu``
that currently defaults to 1500 (standard value). If this variable
is set, it will globally override the mtu, while still keeping the
per-network override.

Change-Id: Ia7e4f9e929f513ddc09e6de9467ec6ff765e2e6f
Closes-Bug: #1518311

commit_message:
Remove references to puppet-openstack from README

The README references to the retired puppet-openstack module
should be removed, as they link to the empty github page.

This patch also cleans up a few other parts of the README,
such as adding a link to the keystone wiki and removing
'%example' from the installation command to match the
other projects.

Change-Id: Ie74ca8a1914cbb2d3de199001b33ced181501a45
Closes-bug: #1518589

commit_message:
Add --names option for 'role assignment list'

The --names option will try to switch the ID value with
the NAME of the entity.

This patch only covers the display of role names.

Change-Id: I302c73fcb40f3134e20695e6dd543025f34e3169
Partial-Bug: #1479569

commit_message:
OpenStackConfig provider

This patch add support for parsing configuration files of projects
which use oslo.config.cfg.MultiStrOpt (currently Neutron LBaaSv2).

For details see:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.config/api/oslo.config.cfg.html#oslo.config.cfg.MultiStrOpt

Change-Id: If782aa4bf83712ac2a5f4d2f4e8ace782409182d

commit_message:
Make argument params of list methods consistent

The argument type "params" is not consistent between list methods of
services client. This patch makes them consistent.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I539291f86fc85013ead4195a78ed722ac794eaa6

subject: Adjust primary bifrost settings for Debian jessie support
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-12-10 14:12:17.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-configdrives-dynamic/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-configdrives-dynamic/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/required_defaults_Debian_jessie.yml'], 'message': "Adjust primary bifrost settings for Debian jessie support

Specific settings are required for Debian jessie as it uses
different defaults from wheezy.

Additionally, we're going to attempt to ensure that the service
folder exists if we're using a systemd template upon install
as sometimes that folder may not be present on systems.

Added genisoimage as a fallback to mkisofs in configuration
drive generation.

Change-Id: I74bf93416513094293bc071fd40e62f4240d61bc
Closes-Bug: 1522552
"}]
commit_message:
Adjust primary bifrost settings for Debian jessie support

Specific settings are required for Debian jessie as it uses
different defaults from wheezy.

Additionally, we're going to attempt to ensure that the service
folder exists if we're using a systemd template upon install
as sometimes that folder may not be present on systems.

Added genisoimage as a fallback to mkisofs in configuration
drive generation.

Change-Id: I74bf93416513094293bc071fd40e62f4240d61bc
Closes-Bug: 1522552

commit_message:
Add VM creation support on Debian jessie

Debian jessie changed the libvirt service name from the prior
release and as such we need additional logic to load the defaults
and a defaults file that represents jessie.

Additionally, we need to ensure that we start the default network
as it may not be started by default on Debian jessie.

Change-Id: I48a64f61d8ba42f76c2df3b984d3090b68e3cf93
Partial-Bug: 1522552

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library
as backend for MySQL connections.
Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
The same implementation as it's done for keystone:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242134/

Change-Id: I730fa419d02ac3910143080121ba19f8be770198

revisions:

Currently the default for the database_connection variable in

Change-Id: Ifa9675d0772f5076bcf60f1a7de6f1fbc69ed354
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database_connection variable in db_spec

Currently the default for the database_connection variable in
manifests::db is sqlite, but the spec expects it to be mysql.
This results in errors when initial commits of projects are
put up for review. This patch changes the expected db connection
to sqlite.

Change-Id: Ifa9675d0772f5076bcf60f1a7de6f1fbc69ed354

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}, {'_account_id': 18438, 'name': 'Qasim Sarfraz', 'email': 'qasims@plumgrid.com', 'username': 'qasims'}, {'_account_id': 18893, 'name': 'Miles Gould', 'email': 'mgould@redhat.com', 'username': 'pozorvlak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-02 18:12:05.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/ironic_inspector_spec.rb', 'manifests/inspector.pp'], 'message': '[inspector] Specify SELinux type context for tftp dir

We create a /tftpboot/ dir in the root directory without
specifying a SELinux type context, so it gets default_t. The
tftp process is not allowed read permission on default_t, and
as a result the ironic-inspector-dnsmasq service fails to
start.

The fix is to specify a type context of tftpdir_t when
creating the /tftpboot/ directory.

This patch also pulls the /tftpboot/ directory out of the if
block relating only to tftp configuration. The /tftpboot/
directory is also used by iPXE/http for the undionly.kpxe
chainloading image.

Change-Id: Id20802b457a8c75d8b1af04a2d2f56b6b776536e
Closes-Bug: 1515630
'}]
commit_message:
[inspector] Specify SELinux type context for tftp dir

We create a /tftpboot/ dir in the root directory without
specifying a SELinux type context, so it gets default_t. The
tftp process is not allowed read permission on default_t, and
as a result the ironic-inspector-dnsmasq service fails to
start.

The fix is to specify a type context of tftpdir_t when
creating the /tftpboot/ directory.

This patch also pulls the /tftpboot/ directory out of the if
block relating only to tftp configuration. The /tftpboot/
directory is also used by iPXE/http for the undionly.kpxe
chainloading image.

Change-Id: Id20802b457a8c75d8b1af04a2d2f56b6b776536e
Closes-Bug: 1515630

commit_message:
Add support for RabbitMQ connection heartbeat

Kilo oslo.messaging added heartbeating support for RabbitMQ
connections.  This patch adds support for this in Puppet modules
by managing the oslo_messaging_rabbit/heartbeat_timeout_threshold
and oslo_messaging_rabbit/heartbeat_rate settings.

Closes-bug: 1467667
Change-Id: I3aef101e3a099bcbd96ee32efa7c5f849e6000cf
(cherry picked from commit 8e4068031037e60646525c37de512c0ffe4443a7)

subject: Pin puppet-swift due to duplicate declaration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-09 15:18:26.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': "Pin puppet-swift due to duplicate declaration

Puppet-swift changed to resource-like class declaration in one spot,
preventing us to declare the swift::storage::account etc. classes
too. The planned fix is to rollback to the include-like style. We'll pin
for the time being.

Change-Id: Iff49ee9720db9514fb2ab82d870470bdb5073327
Related-Bug: #1524381
"}]
commit_message:
Pin puppet-swift due to duplicate declaration

Puppet-swift changed to resource-like class declaration in one spot,
preventing us to declare the swift::storage::account etc. classes
too. The planned fix is to rollback to the include-like style. We'll pin
for the time being.

Change-Id: Iff49ee9720db9514fb2ab82d870470bdb5073327
Related-Bug: #1524381

commit_message:
WIP: Enable OVS tests isolation

Allow tests to spin up their own openvswitch instance,
guaranteeing test isolation (Each openvswitch instance
uses its own database). This is primarily an enabler
for of_lib functional testing.

WIP/To-Do:
* Document OVS server fixture

Follow up:
* Use it in fullstack
* Decide what functional tests may benefit from this

Change-Id: I86362f46ed86c56ab26c692e64e00567f5ae9960

subject: Use whitespace for cinder type-list check.
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-05 20:15:57.000000000', 'files': ['spec/defines/cinder_type_spec.rb', 'manifests/type.pp'], 'message': 'Use whitespace for cinder type-list check.

Hyphens will be matched as a word boundary, so use whitespace to
avoid false positives. For example, with an exisiting "demo-type1"
we can't create a new "type1".

Change-Id: I1167d3e870d1834f57f5cf64ab5cf796344de027
'}]
commit_message:
Use whitespace for cinder type-list check.

Hyphens will be matched as a word boundary, so use whitespace to
avoid false positives. For example, with an exisiting "demo-type1"
we can't create a new "type1".

Change-Id: I1167d3e870d1834f57f5cf64ab5cf796344de027

commit_message:
Replaced private field in get_session/engine with public method

We use private field _factory to get access to the oslo.db
method 'get_legacy_facade()'. It's not quite right and
it could be fixed with the help of the new version of oslo.db.

Closes-Bug: #1516963

Change-Id: I3c5726fdb77a7ab9709f2b1951b673f802c66920

subject: Trivial: Do not use plural format in command parameter in "network delete"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 11:48:56.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/network.rst', 'openstackclient/network/v2/network.py', 'openstackclient/tests/network/v2/test_network.py'], 'message': 'Trivial: Do not use plural format in command parameter in "network delete"

Since "network delete" could delete more than one network,
add a (s) to the doc.

And also, rename the parameter "networks" to "network".
The naming style is not using plural format in parameter.

Change-Id: Id434ea905af34457f84ea6bcb18addef5800429a
'}]
commit_message:
Trivial: Do not use plural format in command parameter in "network delete"

Since "network delete" could delete more than one network,
add a (s) to the doc.

And also, rename the parameter "networks" to "network".
The naming style is not using plural format in parameter.

Change-Id: Id434ea905af34457f84ea6bcb18addef5800429a

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-07 15:59:13.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/pw-token-gen.py'], 'message': "Keep lines that are commented out once

This patch takes all lines starting with a single # (ignoring lines
starting with '##') and inserts them before the yaml is dumped.  The
intended use case is for those that comment out lines during upgrade
/ maintence to not loose that information.

Change-Id: Ic4b2c45ec0820cf1a01a6d459216d1da89e542cd
Closes-Bug: 1483788

commit_message:
Keep lines that are commented out once

This patch takes all lines starting with a single # (ignoring lines
starting with '##') and inserts them before the yaml is dumped.  The
intended use case is for those that comment out lines during upgrade
/ maintence to not loose that information.

Change-Id: Ic4b2c45ec0820cf1a01a6d459216d1da89e542cd
Closes-Bug: 1483788

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ibde388f69e0e6bdc19900e770989d63f0d5f21dd
Closes-bug: #1524824

commit_message:
Tidy up - Primitive

Some Python class and packages need to be renamed
for a better compliance with the shared terminology
which provides a better understanding of Watcher
objects and components by every contributor.

This patchset is there to change
Primitive to Primitives.
Add BasePrimitive.

Partially implements: blueprint glossary-related-refactoring

Change-Id: I839bddd12b5320b338b2f207d74963afa23de522

commit_message:
Rename Command to Action

Some Python class and packages need to be renamed
for a better compliance with the shared terminology
which provides a better understanding of Watcher
objects and components by every contributor.

This patchset is there to change Command to Action

Partially implements: blueprint glossary-related-refactoring

Change-Id: Id38e133fc8b789319c7db5712d3820ecca1bd51d

commit_message:
Remove brackets from portal

In case IPv6 address is present in location os_brick would fail to
get correct path as brackets are forbidden chars in udev and are removed.

Closes-Bug: #1449492
Change-Id: I965ce7bb9bc2b2c3fdd240d998441f8b06b36934

commit_message:
Removed py33, pypy support

As Openstack Liberty now targets Python 2.7 and 3.4,
we should drop Python 3.3 support from our setup.cfg

Change-Id: I8c8f9222fcf1111e99a943976aae9c5b427f7ee4
Closes-Bug: #1523983

commit_message:
Added ACL tests

Added tests to show the impact of ACL's on container consumers.
Added several edge case ACL tests to verify ACLs do not
override RBAC

Change-Id: Ia503a7abf32640260babb693c94c051e478f7b65

subject: Trivial: Remove --project-domain doc in "network create"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 16:11:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/network.rst'], 'message': 'Trivial: Remove --project-domain doc in "network create"

--project-domain option is not implemented for "network create" command
because openstack-sdk does not support it currently. So remove the doc
for now, and add it when the option is implemented.

Change-Id: I78ee9e32698ef477c6fc9c9865448b3592f6e9ad
'}]
commit_message:
Trivial: Remove --project-domain doc in "network create"

--project-domain option is not implemented for "network create" command
because openstack-sdk does not support it currently. So remove the doc
for now, and add it when the option is implemented.

Change-Id: I78ee9e32698ef477c6fc9c9865448b3592f6e9ad

commit_message:
Added constraints tox targets

These are eventually going to be used in gate instead of unconstrained
jobs. There is some code duplication in commands definitions, but tox
does not allow to inherit definitions with {posargs} substitution.

Made tox_install.sh use constraints file to install both the project and
neutron dependency, if the first argument is 'constrained'.

Note: To test the docs targets, needed to fix a formatting issue in
multiple-local-subnets.rst document.

Change-Id: I699022b285594edf3c5db10fbdac2f904dc42928
Partial-Bug: #1522503
Depends-On: Icfc50a0a9330dbc2a59f9bb27f09944bdf0e00d1

subject: devstack: Update after the recent fwaas change
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-10 10:52:14.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/functions'], 'message': 'devstack: Update after the recent fwaas change

The recent neutron-fwaas change [1] made the configuration file
auto-generated during a devstack run.  Unfortunately, we override
neutron_fwaas_configure_driver function, in which the file is
generated.  This change applies the relevant devstack change [2]
to our variant of the function.

[1] I31be3295606ba25929e9af9f40a035ff2b615234
[2] Ic8208850a27408c8fbeed80ecdb43345aa7dfaa4

Closes-Bug: #1524657
Change-Id: I9fb83881a355b907eb4235c432e7666617bf9a7a
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: Update after the recent fwaas change

The recent neutron-fwaas change [1] made the configuration file
auto-generated during a devstack run.  Unfortunately, we override
neutron_fwaas_configure_driver function, in which the file is
generated.  This change applies the relevant devstack change [2]
to our variant of the function.

[1] I31be3295606ba25929e9af9f40a035ff2b615234
[2] Ic8208850a27408c8fbeed80ecdb43345aa7dfaa4

Closes-Bug: #1524657
Change-Id: I9fb83881a355b907eb4235c432e7666617bf9a7a

subject: Allow heat on a dedicated node in a HA setup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 11:22:19.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/site.yml'], 'message': 'Allow heat on a dedicated node in a HA setup

Without this the haproxy role doesn't have the facts it needs to
render it's template, resulting in the following error:

TASK: [haproxy | Copying over config(s)]
************************************** fatal: [control01] => {'msg':
"AnsibleUndefinedVariable: One or more undefined variables: 'dict
object' has no attribute u'ansible_eno1'", 'failed': True}

This is similar to the fix applied previously for other services in
I99b7dbebd5a6193e192ee258ddf576d18db90ed7.

Change-Id: I279374e8861c02e3aa12988b885be7361e0cf2f5
Closes-Bug: 1524739
'}]
commit_message:
Allow heat on a dedicated node in a HA setup

Without this the haproxy role doesn't have the facts it needs to
render it's template, resulting in the following error:

TASK: [haproxy | Copying over config(s)]
************************************** fatal: [control01] => {'msg':
"AnsibleUndefinedVariable: One or more undefined variables: 'dict
object' has no attribute u'ansible_eno1'", 'failed': True}

This is similar to the fix applied previously for other services in
I99b7dbebd5a6193e192ee258ddf576d18db90ed7.

Change-Id: I279374e8861c02e3aa12988b885be7361e0cf2f5
Closes-Bug: 1524739

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-18 03:15:55.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vnxdirect.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vnx_cli.py'], 'message': "VNX: Fix metadata get overriden issue

Cinder is using 'metadata' or 'volume_metadata' to return
volume metadata since versionedobjects is not fully merged,
so VNX could not get the correct existing
metadata, only append VNX specific metadata so existing
metadata get overridden.
In this fix, VNX will first try 'volume_metadata' if not exists,
try 'metadata' when getting metadata.

Change-Id: I1215883a6076e9b15b1ced19aa40aae43c66a00c
Closes-bug: 1516903
"}]
commit_message:
VNX: Fix metadata get overriden issue

Cinder is using 'metadata' or 'volume_metadata' to return
volume metadata since versionedobjects is not fully merged,
so VNX could not get the correct existing
metadata, only append VNX specific metadata so existing
metadata get overridden.
In this fix, VNX will first try 'volume_metadata' if not exists,
try 'metadata' when getting metadata.

Change-Id: I1215883a6076e9b15b1ced19aa40aae43c66a00c
Closes-bug: 1516903

subject: Pass FQDN to host_evacuate.sh command
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-10 14:58:59.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_util_node.py', 'octane/util/node.py', 'octane/handlers/upgrade/compute.py'], 'message': "Pass FQDN to host_evacuate.sh command

FQDN is required for nova to identify the host since version 6.1.

Pass FQDN value from node's data hash to command host_evacuate.sh
if version of the original environment is 6.1 or higher. Pass
the short name (node-N) of the node otherwise.

Closes-bug: 1523469
Change-Id: I5be715f4eab445f3cf823526a98a23e7a1749f2a
"}]
commit_message:
Pass FQDN to host_evacuate.sh command

FQDN is required for nova to identify the host since version 6.1.

Pass FQDN value from node's data hash to command host_evacuate.sh
if version of the original environment is 6.1 or higher. Pass
the short name (node-N) of the node otherwise.

Closes-bug: 1523469
Change-Id: I5be715f4eab445f3cf823526a98a23e7a1749f2a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 11:30:43.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/heat/heat.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/heat/heat_spec.rb'], 'message': "Install heat-docker package only after heat-engine

Heat-engine package is heat-docker dependency,
so if installation of heat-docker package is performed before
heat-engine installation it leads to autostart of heat-engine package
(in that moment override file isn't exist yet, because it will be
triggered directly before evaluation of heat-engine package resource).
As a result, the heat-engine service is run without any configuration.

To fix that we need to sÐµt heat-engine package installation strictly
before heat-docker package.

Change-Id: I5420e64e3ab6b2ca0305f5f41eb722e3ead42b25
Closes-bug: #1520610
"}]
commit_message:
Install heat-docker package only after heat-engine

Heat-engine package is heat-docker dependency,
so if installation of heat-docker package is performed before
heat-engine installation it leads to autostart of heat-engine package
(in that moment override file isn't exist yet, because it will be
triggered directly before evaluation of heat-engine package resource).
As a result, the heat-engine service is run without any configuration.

To fix that we need to sÐµt heat-engine package installation strictly
before heat-docker package.

Change-Id: I5420e64e3ab6b2ca0305f5f41eb722e3ead42b25
Closes-bug: #1520610

revisions:

When copying this documentation over from keystoneclient we much have
simply replaced occurences of keystoneclient with keystoneauth. Details
how to migrate keystoneclient to using sessions make sense in
keystoneclient however the migration doc makes no sense in keystoneauth1
because those parameters don't exist.

Change-Id: I70160f42115d7dfe7610699479baf2e9420fe1b3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove confusing documentation

When copying this documentation over from keystoneclient we much have
simply replaced occurences of keystoneclient with keystoneauth. Details
how to migrate keystoneclient to using sessions make sense in
keystoneclient however the migration doc makes no sense in keystoneauth1
because those parameters don't exist.

Change-Id: I70160f42115d7dfe7610699479baf2e9420fe1b3

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-03 00:35:22.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/unit/storage/test_pool_catalog.py', 'zaqar/storage/pooling.py'], 'message': "Fix queue create failure when metadata is {}

When user pass in {} as the PUT body, below code will take {} as
the flavor name. It's not correct.

flavor = metadata and metadata.get('_flavor', None)

This patch fixes it and add an unit test case for that.

Closes-Bug: #1518060

Depends-On: Ibd1f72ad95515cbfbaef217677c7230662552661
Change-Id: I20b69c99c4e8a44c752006024bc56f5b4cc2336a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix queue create failure when metadata is {}

When user pass in {} as the PUT body, below code will take {} as
the flavor name. It's not correct.

flavor = metadata and metadata.get('_flavor', None)

This patch fixes it and add an unit test case for that.

Closes-Bug: #1518060

Depends-On: Ibd1f72ad95515cbfbaef217677c7230662552661
Change-Id: I20b69c99c4e8a44c752006024bc56f5b4cc2336a

commit_message:
Forbid caching / for fuel-web

New header 'expires -1' forbids caching of / (index.html)
to avoid caching issues which may exist after master node
upgrade. This header is not needed for /static - for JS and
other assets Fuel UI uses its own cachebusting mechanism.

Change-Id: Ic9a199394a0167a4da977b5d135caf676e7d2b67
Closes-Bug: #1475310

commit_message:
Set tunnel timeout for nova_novncproxy

When using websockets in HAProxy, like nova_novncproxy does, we
need to set "timeout tunnel" to avoid disconnections after a short
period without traffic.

Change-Id: I1b66cd9a1d20cbbe35a2ada5782a76a01b14bcd1
Closes-BZ: 1267043

commit_message:
Override $::os_package_type

MOS Ubuntu image uses Debian style packages. Since the introduction
of `$::os_package_type' fact avilable to use in project manifests,
we need to provide a manual override for Fuel Ubuntu images.

This commit updates the preseed template of Precise and Trusty.

Change-Id: Ic3c548d2abd972a071fc910fea2b425908906de5
Closes-Bug: #1517513

subject: Fix a warning with the params class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 01:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Fix a warning with the params class

You cannot use a param in the class arguments because it's evaluated
before the include. This fixes that issue.

Warning: Scope(Class[Cinder]): Could not look up qualified variable
'::cinder::params::lock_path'; class ::cinder::params has not been
evaluated

Change-Id: I703ac2ab0024a6f0095bf50406ab5bb4b8318224
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a warning with the params class

You cannot use a param in the class arguments because it's evaluated
before the include. This fixes that issue.

Warning: Scope(Class[Cinder]): Could not look up qualified variable
'::cinder::params::lock_path'; class ::cinder::params has not been
evaluated

Change-Id: I703ac2ab0024a6f0095bf50406ab5bb4b8318224

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-10 06:51:07.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/api_version_request.py', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Makes microversions config option clear about 'None'

If StrOpt option is explicitly set as None, oslo config
will return it as string "None" which should be invalid
configuration.
Example-
   min_microversion = None will be end up with 'None'.

This commit makes that clear in config and raise exception
for the same.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: I81e86faca6f8c0ffb7da22154a62236ac25cf0c0
'}]
commit_message:
Makes microversions config option clear about 'None'

If StrOpt option is explicitly set as None, oslo config
will return it as string "None" which should be invalid
configuration.
Example-
   min_microversion = None will be end up with 'None'.

This commit makes that clear in config and raise exception
for the same.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: I81e86faca6f8c0ffb7da22154a62236ac25cf0c0

commit_message:
Replace ceilometer with correct project name

Currently when setting up a new project, the cookiecutter
sets the logging spec to expect ceilometer configs, which
results in errors if not changed. This patch will replace
'ceilometer' with the correct name to avoid this.

Change-Id: I05d38cc87f25c8161b8f4ee43fb5ba72cea49ca6

To avoid having extra L3HARouterAgentPortBinding with l3_agent as None,
operation of setting l3_agent should be atomic.
For this purpose, transaction was added in methods
create_ha_port_and_bind and _bind_ha_router_to_agents in change
Iaad82fe522cfd70061daecf411c924fdc11b7e41

In case if router was just created and l3 agent was not scheduled yet,
so l3_agent_id is None, l3-agent-list-hosting-router <router> will fail.

commit_message:
Skip bindings with agent_id=None

To avoid having extra L3HARouterAgentPortBinding with l3_agent as None,
operation of setting l3_agent should be atomic.
For this purpose, transaction was added in methods
create_ha_port_and_bind and _bind_ha_router_to_agents in change
Iaad82fe522cfd70061daecf411c924fdc11b7e41

In case if router was just created and l3 agent was not scheduled yet,
so l3_agent_id is None, l3-agent-list-hosting-router <router> will fail.
This change makes it work by skipping binding with agent_id=None.

Partial-bug: #1499647

Change-Id: I1aaf4b651f738febc26b0e1105aeabe066bca2a0

commit_message:
Allow to fetch logs from the logrotated log files

Current implementation allows to fetch data only from such files as
`puppet-apply.log`. But for now there are also rotated log files (logs
which are created by logrotate) such as, just for example,
`puppet-apply.log.1.gz`. Which should be also parsed and returned in
response. The functionality, which is included in this patch, does this.

Closes-Bug: #1512280
Change-Id: I7dc2b330a95a3a97ed3b83925139135ed9cf4b1f

commit_message:
Fix the run_test unchecked pep8 W503 errors

Now thw flake8 did not check W503 error,
W503:doesn't allow binary ops at start of line,
And this patch fixes it.

subject: Remove default handling for 'RETRY' actions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 04:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/scheduler.py'], 'message': "Remove default handling for 'RETRY' actions

An action with a RETRY return code will be set to READY status. This
READY action should be later scheduled by the scheduler for execution.
This patch removes the default behavior of restarting the action. The
logic is not right.

Change-Id: I339126ce62b12d9d01173df242f21cdab6305a86
"}]
commit_message:
Remove default handling for 'RETRY' actions

An action with a RETRY return code will be set to READY status. This
READY action should be later scheduled by the scheduler for execution.
This patch removes the default behavior of restarting the action. The
logic is not right.

Change-Id: I339126ce62b12d9d01173df242f21cdab6305a86

commit_message:
Report bugs against openstack-api-site

For RST projects, set the launchpad project users report bugs against to
"openstack-api-site".

This variable will be used by the next openstackdocstheme update.

Closes-Bug: #1524476

Switch gnocchi to use os_service_default fact

fact for configuration options that default to '<SERVICE DEFAULT>'.

commit_message:
Allow specifying bug ref instead of BP

As Ironic moves towards deprecating Launchpad blueprints in favor
of Launchpad bugs, allow specifying bug reference instead of blueprint
in the spec proposed.

For backward compatibility both blueprint and bug references are
allowed.

Change-Id: I7bcfe4c2dfa1974a066260ca8d4aa02897a15ecf

commit_message:
Evacuate VMs from Compute node

In preparation phase of the upgrade of a node, evacuate virtual machines
from that node to other hosts using live migration.

This feature only supported for nodes where live migration is available.

Change-Id: I13a20b884aea1e3058a93f5459955b4d2a8a2089
Related-bug: 1523469

commit_message:
Bind rabbitmq, epmd, and management plugin to internal IP

RabbitMQ itself was already listening on the correct IP
for controllers, but epmd and management plugin listened
everywhere (although management was covered by firewall
rules).

This covers all RabbitMQ server connection binding so that
all connections are done on the same IP address (with the
unfortunate side effect of blocking localhost connections).

Removed unused parameter rabbitmq_host from
nailgun::rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I9bfb8bc85fcd6d4711c4ca9d79745ad2ce7e673a
Closes-Bug: #1501731

subject: Fix broken "English" label in language-popover
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8735, 'name': 'Vitaly Kramskikh', 'email': 'vkramskikh@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkramskikh'}, {'_account_id': 8766, 'name': 'Julia Aranovich', 'email': 'jkirnosova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'CesarSar'}, {'_account_id': 8970, 'name': 'Bogdan Dudko', 'email': 'bdudko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'b-zone'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9091, 'name': 'Alexandra Morozova', 'email': 'astepanchuk@mirantis.com', 'username': 'astepanchuk'}, {'_account_id': 19560, 'name': 'Dmitry Bilunov', 'email': 'kmeaw@kmeaw.com', 'username': 'dbilunov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-12-10 12:36:05.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/static/styles/main.less'], 'message': 'Fix broken "English" label in language-popover

CSS layout uses .popover-layout mixin, which fits the contents in a
pre-specified width (defaults to 260px). Popover classes include this
mixin so children widths are calculated during compile-time using Less
arithmetic expansions.

If a text node overflows the container word-wrapping rules would emerge
and cause this bug. Currently, offset calculations are implied by the
triangle arrow positioning stuff, which moves the popover container to
the right (using negative left offset) while moving the arrow (using
positive right offset). To preserve the correct layout, popover block
width should be known in prior.

We can avoid these calculations (still retaining current look-and-feel)
by re-aligning the arrow, setting the .language-popover left offset to
zero and using CSS transformations to translate the whole block to the
left by the half of its width. It would allow as not to rely on a fixed
width, so the box model will expand the blocks as necessary to fit the
text nodes - on my screen it allows language names up to 16 narrow
chars (like 'a') or 10 wide chars ('A').

However, much simplier solution is just changing the padding of the
language name label. In case a longer word won't fit inside the
container, we can always update the @width parameter.

Closes-Bug: 1522341
Change-Id: I182a37da42bd546e72a57ba117b7be15ee187c5f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken "English" label in language-popover

CSS layout uses .popover-layout mixin, which fits the contents in a
pre-specified width (defaults to 260px). Popover classes include this
mixin so children widths are calculated during compile-time using Less
arithmetic expansions.

If a text node overflows the container word-wrapping rules would emerge
and cause this bug. Currently, offset calculations are implied by the
triangle arrow positioning stuff, which moves the popover container to
the right (using negative left offset) while moving the arrow (using
positive right offset). To preserve the correct layout, popover block
width should be known in prior.

We can avoid these calculations (still retaining current look-and-feel)
by re-aligning the arrow, setting the .language-popover left offset to
zero and using CSS transformations to translate the whole block to the
left by the half of its width. It would allow as not to rely on a fixed
width, so the box model will expand the blocks as necessary to fit the
text nodes - on my screen it allows language names up to 16 narrow
chars (like 'a') or 10 wide chars ('A').

However, much simplier solution is just changing the padding of the
language name label. In case a longer word won't fit inside the
container, we can always update the @width parameter.

Closes-Bug: 1522341
Change-Id: I182a37da42bd546e72a57ba117b7be15ee187c5f

in Mitaka. It is replaced by Aodh.

Aodh support is added in a follow-up to this patch.

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I60b149809335555d8375f0f128d5bd9b11dc86ea
Closes-bug: #1524824

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I79689d70d14239387f7ad9646eaf6cd2994ebcf7
Closes-bug: #1524824

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-12-02 22:43:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/fake_driver.py'], 'message': 'Add a FakeGateDriver

Currently there are a few features that do not have a reference
implementation. These features include Consistency Group (CG),
replication, etc. As a result, any changes to CG and replication
cannot be easily tested. For example, when CG was converted to
versioned objects, developers who were working on the conversion
could not test CG functionality because LVM does not support it.

This patch will add a FakeGateDriver to fake_driver.py under
tests/unit. This driver will inherit from the LVM driver and
implement functions for CG, replication, etc for testing
purpose only. This allows developers who do not have access to
a backend that supports these features to do some sanity testing
using the fake driver.

Related to this, tempest tests are submitted for CG APIs so that
third party CI can run them for drivers with CG support:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252213/

Implements: blueprint gate-driver
Change-Id: I1d5868a72741b80069656efc957cfb492889b36c
'}]
commit_message:
Add a FakeGateDriver

Currently there are a few features that do not have a reference
implementation. These features include Consistency Group (CG),
replication, etc. As a result, any changes to CG and replication
cannot be easily tested. For example, when CG was converted to
versioned objects, developers who were working on the conversion
could not test CG functionality because LVM does not support it.

This patch will add a FakeGateDriver to fake_driver.py under
tests/unit. This driver will inherit from the LVM driver and
implement functions for CG, replication, etc for testing
purpose only. This allows developers who do not have access to
a backend that supports these features to do some sanity testing
using the fake driver.

Related to this, tempest tests are submitted for CG APIs so that
third party CI can run them for drivers with CG support:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252213/

Implements: blueprint gate-driver
Change-Id: I1d5868a72741b80069656efc957cfb492889b36c

commit_message:
Allow to set share visibility using "manage" API

This fix allows manila manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".

Change-Id: I8725719b8c7ff5557fa20ebbb5314f3e770ffcc0
Closes-Bug: #1436865

commit_message:
Added new projects for the OSA role break out

The change adds new projects for the roles within OpenStack-Ansible
This is the second batch for the break out work which encompases the
OpenStack-Ansible play `setup-infrastructure.yml`.

New projects:
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-memcached_server
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-rsyslog_server

Governance Review: https://review.openstack.org/255372

Change-Id: Ia7509050693d81a4b3e01898ea4d5a6bfac3d598
Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Making names of Cinder client classes consistent

This patch makes names of Cinder client classes like

    Base<Resource>sClient and <Resource>sClient

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I92d0c3ea176900dfa70582e302f7c510ec229db4

subject: Fix for bug "task stuck in RUNNING state"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5558, 'name': 'Winson Chan', 'email': 'wcchan@stackstorm.com', 'username': 'winson-c-chan'}, {'_account_id': 7700, 'name': 'Nikolay Mahotkin', 'email': 'nikolay.makhotkin@gmail.com', 'username': 'nmakhotkin'}, {'_account_id': 8731, 'name': 'Renat Akhmerov', 'email': 'renat.akhmerov@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakhmerov'}, {'_account_id': 9029, 'name': 'Moshe Elisha', 'email': 'moshe.elisha@nokia.com', 'username': 'MosheElisha'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 19206, 'name': 'Dawid Deja', 'email': 'dawdej@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddeja'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-02 15:31:22.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix for bug "task stuck in RUNNING state"

The main cause was checking if all executions are complited
and setting state of execution in the same transaction. So in
case that two threads are running transactions simultanously
noone sees, that other action is ended. This commit split transaction
and add new method that will only change task state to SUCCESS, if
its in RUNNING state.

Closes-Bug: 1513456

Change-Id: I8235d6741c5de027cec81d167c739f7ec8ad0cab
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for bug "task stuck in RUNNING state"

The main cause was checking if all executions are complited
and setting state of execution in the same transaction. So in
case that two threads are running transactions simultanously
noone sees, that other action is ended. This commit split transaction
and add new method that will only change task state to SUCCESS, if
its in RUNNING state.

Closes-Bug: 1513456

Change-Id: I8235d6741c5de027cec81d167c739f7ec8ad0cab

Don't include MANIFEST.in by default

Everything in this file is automatically generated by pbr, projects
can provide their MANIFEST.in if they need.

Change-Id: Ibea1aeb726e95cd9047c9361e44925151ffc4b33

subject: Remove openstack_version file
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-09 14:30:31.000000000', 'files': ['config.mk', 'iso/module.mk', 'iso/ks.template'], 'message': 'Remove openstack_version file

/etc/fuel_openstack_version file is provided
by fuel-openstack-metadata package and can
be used to format paths where we put repos
and puppet modules during ISO build.
This patch removes all the lines that
assume direct using of openstack.yaml file.

Change-Id: I728fa53c16462bfb44328a619a151dc836573875
Closes-Bug: #1524359
'}]
commit_message:
Remove openstack_version file

/etc/fuel_openstack_version file is provided
by fuel-openstack-metadata package and can
be used to format paths where we put repos
and puppet modules during ISO build.
This patch removes all the lines that
assume direct using of openstack.yaml file.

Change-Id: I728fa53c16462bfb44328a619a151dc836573875
Closes-Bug: #1524359

subject: Fix neutron issue w/ l2pop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 01:21:33.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_neutron/tasks/neutron_post_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/templates/neutron.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Fix neutron issue w/ l2pop

This change resolves an issue where neutron is not able to bind to
a given port because l2 population is disabled and no vxlan multicast
group has been defined. To resolve this the `neutron_l2_population`
variable is being defined and set to "False" in the os_neutron defaults
and the vxlan multicast group will now contain a default value instead
of an empty string.

The change also removes the neutron_l2_population checks in the tasks
and templates because the variable is now being defined.

Change-Id: Ic2973626d88781bfc67a4275afcf9feffeb63f36
Closes-Bug: #1521793
Co-Authored-by: Ville Vuorinen <ville.vuorinen@multim.fi>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 00609ea56e09f5dd0488062b64a03420d296e614)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron issue w/ l2pop

This change resolves an issue where neutron is not able to bind to
a given port because l2 population is disabled and no vxlan multicast
group has been defined. To resolve this the `neutron_l2_population`
variable is being defined and set to "False" in the os_neutron defaults
and the vxlan multicast group will now contain a default value instead
of an empty string.

The change also removes the neutron_l2_population checks in the tasks
and templates because the variable is now being defined.

Change-Id: Ic2973626d88781bfc67a4275afcf9feffeb63f36
Closes-Bug: #1521793
Co-Authored-by: Ville Vuorinen <ville.vuorinen@multim.fi>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 00609ea56e09f5dd0488062b64a03420d296e614)

Currently, if a deletion fails from the storage engine, the metric is

commit_message:
storage: retry to delete metric on failure

Currently, if a deletion fails from the storage engine, the metric is
still expunged from the indexer, meaning metricd will not retry to
delete it.

Let's make it retry by not expunging the metric from the indexer.

Change-Id: Id2c14cbbedda66aa3be4327a142f26415debf5db
(cherry picked from commit 63b0271856158414cbcb632bfed790fcb3d10917)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 11:13:52.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/statsd.py'], 'message': 'statsd: fix flush() scheduling

Currently, flush() is scheduled only _once_. Indeed, loop.call_later()
is not "recursive", as it does not reschedule every flush_delay seconds
the call. It only does it once!
So let's build a closure that reschedule itself each time.

Change-Id: I2e16101890996a51cb2baa4ae7b21dd6d1e3c801
'}]
commit_message:
statsd: fix flush() scheduling

Currently, flush() is scheduled only _once_. Indeed, loop.call_later()
is not "recursive", as it does not reschedule every flush_delay seconds
the call. It only does it once!
So let's build a closure that reschedule itself each time.

Change-Id: I2e16101890996a51cb2baa4ae7b21dd6d1e3c801

commit_message:

The test did not take into account that even with the limits set,

commit_message:
Fix exposition of bug about limiting with ldap

The test did not take into account that even with the limits set,
as part of some internal calculation we want to get the full list
of entities. Calling the API without a hints list should achieve
this, and return all available entries.

Drop the custom test and use generic LimitTests.

Change-Id: Id3120ed66cc23228edcf18e0177c1df1955ac5e7
Partial-Bug: 1501698

commit_message:
Fix T110 violation for database client

T110 requires methods, which calls GET, should be "list_<resource>s"
or "show_<resource>" as these names for consistency.
In addition, the other service clients doesn't contain "_details" on
the method names.
So this patch renames get_db_flavor_details to show_db_flavor on
database client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ia0b509ad9c4413c3ea9910e06d7c60c0c4f6896e

Closes-Bug: #1524081

commit_message:
[V3] Rename get_policy to show_policy

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to policy client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ic4cfe4a5ec5695d943f7dca9579c545285fb2719

commit_message:
Make keepalived add_vip idempotent

L3 agent operations are designed to be idempotent to be resiliant
in the face of missed notifications, out of order notifications
processing and agent restarts. One exception is keepalived's
add_vip that was made to explicitly barf when the agent tries
to add a vip that was already inserted to keepalive'd internal
cache. This was done in patch 142630 by my request to root
out bugs. Well, we found such a bug and in retrospect may not
have been the smartest idea.

Change-Id: Iead975787e2847828286d7b644dcbe33cf57ace9
Related-Bug: #1523999

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-12-10 11:25:18.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_log_api/tests/test_logs.py', 'monasca_log_api/v2/common/service.py', 'etc/monasca/log-api-config.conf', 'java/src/main/java/monasca/log/api/ApiConfig.java', 'java/src/test/java/monasca/log/api/app/LogServiceTest.java', 'etc/monasca/log-api-config.ini', 'monasca_log_api_tempest/services/log_api_client.py', 'java/src/main/java/monasca/log/api/resource/exception/Exceptions.java', 'java/src/main/java/monasca/log/api/resource/LogResource.java', 'java/src/main/java/monasca/log/api/common/LogApiConstants.java', 'monasca_log_api_tempest/tests/log_api/test_constraints.py', 'monasca_log_api/tests/test_service.py', 'monasca_log_api/v2/reference/logs.py', 'monasca_log_api_tempest/tests/base.py', 'java/src/main/java/monasca/log/api/app/LogService.java', 'java/src/test/java/monasca/log/api/utils/TestUtils.java', 'java/src/test/java/monasca/log/api/resource/LogResourceTest.java', 'monasca_log_api/v2/common/log_publisher.py'], 'message': "Validating message size

Received request's content should be validated if
its size does not exceed allowed value. Bytes refers
to byte size of the object instead of amount
of characters. This change is required in order
to reject those meesages that couldn't be processed
by Kafka queue.

Changed:
- added payload size validation to Python
- added validation of message size that it sent to Kafka
- reworked validation of message size in Java

Change-Id: I2acc647550d7c851a5715a7cf44f749db1f54d7b
"}]
commit_message:
Validating message size

Received request's content should be validated if
its size does not exceed allowed value. Bytes refers
to byte size of the object instead of amount
of characters. This change is required in order
to reject those meesages that couldn't be processed
by Kafka queue.

Changed:
- added payload size validation to Python
- added validation of message size that it sent to Kafka
- reworked validation of message size in Java

Change-Id: I2acc647550d7c851a5715a7cf44f749db1f54d7b

commit_message:
Fix adding physical port to ovs bridge

When ovs provider is used for everything, deployments fail during task
netconfig.pp due to l2_port/ovs provider does not flush previous routes.

Change-Id: I1db11f55e309bf343ce98545eb6e6641b9872a49
Closes-bug: #1524294

commit_message:
Add validate_with_client in BaseCustomConstraint

Since we replace not found error with EntityNotFound instead,
we can now consider use a common function for validate_with_client in most
of constraints. For some constraints that have a more complex validation will
overwrite the function(This is what we already used).

Change-Id: I1c554ba7848279cd60db1661fe7ebbd5b72235d8

subject: Rename 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS' to 'AVAILABLE_KEYSTONE_ENDPOINTS'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-10 11:18:28.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/context_processors.py', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/test/settings.py'], 'message': "Rename 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS' to 'AVAILABLE_KEYSTONE_ENDPOINTS'

This should remove a constant source of confusion when dealing with
regions-related issues (since 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS' gets mixed up with
Keystone regions).

Use utils.get_available_keystone_endpoints() method from
openstack_auth, which emits a deprecation notice in case an old
version of setting is used.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I482fb71e914131321090d9b2403303c7731e114b
"}]
commit_message:
Rename 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS' to 'AVAILABLE_KEYSTONE_ENDPOINTS'

This should remove a constant source of confusion when dealing with
regions-related issues (since 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS' gets mixed up with
Keystone regions).

Use utils.get_available_keystone_endpoints() method from
openstack_auth, which emits a deprecation notice in case an old
version of setting is used.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I482fb71e914131321090d9b2403303c7731e114b

commit_message:
creates a dispatcher abstraction

This change creates a dispatcher abstraction
to document the interface of a dispatcher.

And also allows in the futur to have attributes with default values.

Change-Id: I9a7e5e03f89635a3790b3851f492a1a7aab58feb

'Fix Commited' is used as a step for manual QA verification before
the bug is marked as 'Fix Released' for fuel projects, so we would
prefer to continue using 'delay-release' workflow.

* Add 'delay-release' option to all projects in 'fuel' group

commit_message:
Add 'delay-release' option to fuel projects

'Fix Commited' is used as a step for manual QA verification before
the bug is marked as 'Fix Released' for fuel projects, so we would
prefer to continue using 'delay-release' workflow.

* Add 'delay-release' option to all projects in 'fuel' group
* Add 'delay-release' option to fuel plugins in 'lma-toolchain' group

Change-Id: I50f766c0c3482cd5d9f0e2a7f0ba0f80faa054b6

commit_message:
Add sphinx doc build with tox

* Add basic doc build system with sphinx and tox
* Update README.md for how-to build docs
* Update .gitignore to exclude docs builds
* Add index and move README for Noop tests framework
* TODO split and add more details for how-to noop tests
  setup/use/create

Inspired by https://github.com/openstack/openstack-manuals

Partial-bug: #1483288

Change-Id: I982e0baaff5de95c7d0c4b3f098754a80676f0d0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

Partial-Bug: #1518082
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude Horizon tmp directory from health checks

Corosync would stop the cluster if free space goes below critical
threshold. However Horizon tmp partition overfilling would not impact
cluster durability.

Change-Id: I9e20c8baaaef94fdeddc3b4d55f8ec35865fa115
Partial-Bug: #1518082

commit_message:
Add neutron agents to ironic node role when DVR is enabled

Ironic nodes requires neutron agents as well as regular nova-compute
when neutron DVR is enabled.

Change-Id: I8fc04727c0b4d6e55c2f0ff9f712cc9fddda6e8b
Closes-bug: #1522364

we need all Astute output including debug.

commit_message:
Use hiera_hash lookup for network_metadata

Replace hiera() with hiera_hash() for 'network_metadata' key to
provide override possibility.

Closes-bug: #1524336

Refactor action generator

When contributor wants to support new OpenStack service actions in
Mistral, there is no need to add different ActionGenerator classes
respectively and its corresponding unit tests.

subject: [Verify] Fixing issue with running non-existing test suite
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-10 09:16:12.000000000', 'files': ['rally/verification/tempest/tempest.py', 'tests/unit/verification/test_tempest.py'], 'message': '[Verify] Fixing issue with running non-existing test suite

If we run some non-existing test suite, an error will happen while
parsing test results to put them into data base, and status of the
corresponding verification will be "verifying" instead of "failed".

Rally shouldn't put the results of non-existing tests into data base,
because there are no such tests and test results, and status of the
corresponding verification should be set to "failed".

Closes-Bug: #1520952

Change-Id: I2c9476e334125b08d3e28ce2949ec43fe99cfe24
'}]
commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing issue with running non-existing test suite

If we run some non-existing test suite, an error will happen while
parsing test results to put them into data base, and status of the
corresponding verification will be "verifying" instead of "failed".

Rally shouldn't put the results of non-existing tests into data base,
because there are no such tests and test results, and status of the
corresponding verification should be set to "failed".

Closes-Bug: #1520952

Change-Id: I2c9476e334125b08d3e28ce2949ec43fe99cfe24

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-07 07:14:26.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: I2d0253b0305792862111db8b1e7adc2289863ee3
Closes-Bug: #1368661
'}]
commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: I2d0253b0305792862111db8b1e7adc2289863ee3
Closes-Bug: #1368661

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 06:17:44.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/volumes.py'], 'message': 'volumes_links attribute not allowd in volume list

When GETting os-volumes, the returned list of volumes respects the
osapi_max_limit configuration parameter but does not provide a link to
the next element in the list.
But volumes_links attribute not allowd in volume list. We need to add
volumes_links attribute in tempest.

Change-Id: I22436e33d640b6ca6bf15a7f582d0cef46d30565
Closes-Bug: 1504641
'}]
commit_message:
volumes_links attribute not allowd in volume list

When GETting os-volumes, the returned list of volumes respects the
osapi_max_limit configuration parameter but does not provide a link to
the next element in the list.
But volumes_links attribute not allowd in volume list. We need to add
volumes_links attribute in tempest.

Change-Id: I22436e33d640b6ca6bf15a7f582d0cef46d30565
Closes-Bug: 1504641

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-12 15:28:52.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_service/service.py'], 'message': 'Change info log message to warning on graceful shutdown timeout exceeding

graceful shutdown timeout insures that service will not wait forever.
If graceful shutdown timeout is exceeded service is closed
instantaneously(not graceful) and it can mean that server or client
contains shutdown bug.

Change-Id: I880afffec67cec31cb9fc033881f20b0e0a1c376
'}]
commit_message:
Change info log message to warning on graceful shutdown timeout exceeding

graceful shutdown timeout insures that service will not wait forever.
If graceful shutdown timeout is exceeded service is closed
instantaneously(not graceful) and it can mean that server or client
contains shutdown bug.

Change-Id: I880afffec67cec31cb9fc033881f20b0e0a1c376

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-16 15:19:16.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/compute/json/versions_client.py', 'tempest/tests/services/compute/test_versions_client.py'], 'message': 'Added processing /compute URL for getting list of versions

After implementing blueprint "Ability to run some Nova services under Apache2"(
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2)
it becomes possible not to use separate ports for each openstack service but
share 80 port with different URL prefixes. Mailing list thread with
discussion the details of this feature:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067147.html.
Openstack wiki page with mapping urls to services:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/URLs.

If nova-api service is started by Apache (or similar),
using 'Alias' directive script name contains alias-prefix.
We get things like: '/ALIAS/NAME/v2', '/ALIAS/NAME/v2.1'

This change makes sure we compose correct url for getting list of versions.

Change-Id: Ibf7937aca468f75a99e171a9495673bf8f446b01
'}]
commit_message:
Added processing /compute URL for getting list of versions

After implementing blueprint "Ability to run some Nova services under Apache2"(
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2)
it becomes possible not to use separate ports for each openstack service but
share 80 port with different URL prefixes. Mailing list thread with
discussion the details of this feature:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067147.html.
Openstack wiki page with mapping urls to services:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/URLs.

If nova-api service is started by Apache (or similar),
using 'Alias' directive script name contains alias-prefix.
We get things like: '/ALIAS/NAME/v2', '/ALIAS/NAME/v2.1'

This change makes sure we compose correct url for getting list of versions.

Change-Id: Ibf7937aca468f75a99e171a9495673bf8f446b01

* extend devstack-rally-gate with monasca plugin
* add job-template for monasca test in rally.yaml
* add monasca test run in layout.yaml
* add monasca to all jobs use devstack-rally-gate builder
* add monasca job in projects.yaml

commit_message:
Synced requirements with global requirements

We have issues with coverage job and during the debugging
of coverage script I found the issue with incorrect
requirements and incorrect tox version.

After this fix coverage script will work fine.

Change-Id: I4731dd735abc6ea13a084952688c3b0257f6d7e1
Closes-Bug: #1523959

subject: Add ansible-role-(diskimage-builder|jenkins-job-builder)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-09 20:30:55.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/ansible-role-diskimage-builder.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/ansible-role-jenkins-job-builder.config', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add ansible-role-(diskimage-builder|jenkins-job-builder)

Here we are just adding ansible-role-diskimage-builder and
ansible-role-jenkins-job-builder into the OpenStack gerrit workflow.

After talking with both openstack-infra and third party CI teams it
was decided to deal with which team this would be part of a later
date.

Additionally, we have not created a launchpad project for this module
or pypi (since we won't release there).

Gerritbot was also not configured at this time, since we don't know
which team we are going to be part of.

Change-Id: I18397f709059e3c4455f3fe9df2be08a6993fe7f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add ansible-role-(diskimage-builder|jenkins-job-builder)

Here we are just adding ansible-role-diskimage-builder and
ansible-role-jenkins-job-builder into the OpenStack gerrit workflow.

After talking with both openstack-infra and third party CI teams it
was decided to deal with which team this would be part of a later
date.

Additionally, we have not created a launchpad project for this module
or pypi (since we won't release there).

Gerritbot was also not configured at this time, since we don't know
which team we are going to be part of.

Change-Id: I18397f709059e3c4455f3fe9df2be08a6993fe7f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Pass environment variables of proxy to tox
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-08 08:34:33.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ie98057a71fe516c6c96e6ac88cc5540ed9d6966d
'}]
commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ie98057a71fe516c6c96e6ac88cc5540ed9d6966d

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-12-09 13:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['etc/api-paste.ini', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/app.py', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/neutron.conf'], 'message': 'Added CORS support to Neutron

This adds the CORS support middleware to Neutron, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For neutron, both the paste.ini and the direct-wrap method of
deploying the middleware were chosen, since neutron is in a state of
migration to pecan. Note that if someone deploys pecan-neutron behind
other middleware, any responses provided by that middleware will not
be CORS-enabled, as these responses would be returned before the
headers could be annotated. This results in a response not readable
by the user agent.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact: Add link to CORS configuration in admin cloud guide.

Change-Id: I02acea6124d28370d92e7c94ca2d1d6c5c8937ac
'}]
commit_message:
Added CORS support to Neutron

This adds the CORS support middleware to Neutron, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For neutron, both the paste.ini and the direct-wrap method of
deploying the middleware were chosen, since neutron is in a state of
migration to pecan. Note that if someone deploys pecan-neutron behind
other middleware, any responses provided by that middleware will not
be CORS-enabled, as these responses would be returned before the
headers could be annotated. This results in a response not readable
by the user agent.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact: Add link to CORS configuration in admin cloud guide.

Change-Id: I02acea6124d28370d92e7c94ca2d1d6c5c8937ac

There are some methods (`_get_endpoint_groups_for_project` and

controller and manager, move those methods into manager so that

subject: Add shell --profile option to trigger osprofiler from CLI
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-09 15:03:41.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add shell --profile option to trigger osprofiler from CLI

Currently the only way to trigger osprofiler (tracing) is to use
python-keystoneclient as is and python lib. This patch add new option
--profile that will do this from CLI.

So if you have installed osprofiler lib and you will type

keystone --profile SECRET_KEY user-lsit

At the end of output there will be message with <trace_id>
to plot nice HTML graphs use command:

osprofiler trace show <trace_id> --html --out result.html

Based on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/114856/

Related patch:
(main patch in keystone) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103368/

Change-Id: I534fdd8c55885b9d6d9ba2443a7d90b8144b5d1e
'}]
commit_message:
Add shell --profile option to trigger osprofiler from CLI

Currently the only way to trigger osprofiler (tracing) is to use
python-keystoneclient as is and python lib. This patch add new option
--profile that will do this from CLI.

So if you have installed osprofiler lib and you will type

keystone --profile SECRET_KEY user-lsit

At the end of output there will be message with <trace_id>
to plot nice HTML graphs use command:

osprofiler trace show <trace_id> --html --out result.html

Based on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/114856/

Related patch:
(main patch in keystone) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103368/

Change-Id: I534fdd8c55885b9d6d9ba2443a7d90b8144b5d1e
