subject: Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 08:21:30.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/base.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_workflow_resume.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_trigger_service.py', 'mistral/db/sqlalchemy/base.py', 'mistral/tests/functional/api/v2/test_mistral_basic_v2.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_locking.py', 'releasenotes/notes/changing-isolation-level-to-read-committed-7080833ad284b901.yaml', 'mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/tests/resources/wf_task_ex_concurrency.yaml', 'mistral/tests/functional/base.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/tests/resources/wf_action_ex_concurrency.yaml', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

The state of a workflow execution was not updated even when all task
executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I12f66134d92b8ed39df9d6128d7de5ee49aa8623
Closes-Bug: #1518012
Closes-Bug: #1513456
(cherry picked from commit 976667c0a22f604559e19135f30dea803e3080f6)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

The state of a workflow execution was not updated even when all task
executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I12f66134d92b8ed39df9d6128d7de5ee49aa8623
Closes-Bug: #1518012
Closes-Bug: #1513456
(cherry picked from commit 976667c0a22f604559e19135f30dea803e3080f6)

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-12-09 08:02:04.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/base.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_workflow_resume.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_trigger_service.py', 'mistral/db/sqlalchemy/base.py', 'mistral/tests/functional/api/v2/test_mistral_basic_v2.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_locking.py', 'releasenotes/notes/changing-isolation-level-to-read-committed-7080833ad284b901.yaml', 'mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/tests/resources/wf_task_ex_concurrency.yaml', 'mistral/tests/functional/base.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/tests/resources/wf_action_ex_concurrency.yaml', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

The state of a workflow execution was not updated even when all task
executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I12f66134d92b8ed39df9d6128d7de5ee49aa8623
Closes-Bug: #1518012
Closes-Bug: #1513456
'}]
commit_message:
Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

The state of a workflow execution was not updated even when all task
executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I12f66134d92b8ed39df9d6128d7de5ee49aa8623
Closes-Bug: #1518012
Closes-Bug: #1513456

commit_message:
fix mongo create database

Mongodb guestagent was raising an exception when trying to create a
new database because the os_admin user did not have permissions to
write to any database in mongo.

Added the role readWriteAnyDatabase to the os_admin user and this
resolved this issue.

Change-Id: Id81bf64515600f92ddfcea995b82ab0d5afb5071
Closes-Bug: #1517194

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-08 22:08:09.000000000', 'files': ['devops/shell.py', 'devops/models/node.py', 'devops/models/environment.py'], 'message': "Fix devops create method

This change fixes the regression introduced by change
Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7 which broke the use of the
'dos.py create' shell command. The refactoring of the Environment to
support templates changed when the nodes and networks get defined and
saved in the DB. Since the ordering changed, this creation of the admin
node via the do_create method no longer works. Additionaly the
Environment.create_interfaces function was changed but not updated in
all places where it was used. This change adds the previous verison of
the function back as create_interfaces_from_networks.

This change ensures the networks are defined prior to the creation of
the admin node for the create command, slave nodes are created as part
of the do_create function and updates the node model so that it can
properly be attached to networks.

Change-Id: I965f647285d8eca28a71a2d31708eee7a6d36b4d
Closes-Bug: #1521520
"}]
commit_message:
Fix devops create method

This change fixes the regression introduced by change
Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7 which broke the use of the
'dos.py create' shell command. The refactoring of the Environment to
support templates changed when the nodes and networks get defined and
saved in the DB. Since the ordering changed, this creation of the admin
node via the do_create method no longer works. Additionaly the
Environment.create_interfaces function was changed but not updated in
all places where it was used. This change adds the previous verison of
the function back as create_interfaces_from_networks.

This change ensures the networks are defined prior to the creation of
the admin node for the create command, slave nodes are created as part
of the do_create function and updates the node model so that it can
properly be attached to networks.

Change-Id: I965f647285d8eca28a71a2d31708eee7a6d36b4d
Closes-Bug: #1521520

subject: Add 'is_still_owner' lock test function
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-20 02:21:10.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/locking.py', 'tooz/drivers/file.py', 'tooz/drivers/zookeeper.py', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py', 'tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': "Add 'is_still_owner' lock test function

Distributed locks have the tendency to become acquired
and then after this point, perhaps becoming unacquired since
locks are typically on a remote machine and things like
network disconnects and such can (and do) happen causing
the running application to need an ability to check if it
is still the owner of the lock (and react appropriately).

Change-Id: I31a79a093c14c31b47f7f0b2a7bb06d77a793186
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'is_still_owner' lock test function

Distributed locks have the tendency to become acquired
and then after this point, perhaps becoming unacquired since
locks are typically on a remote machine and things like
network disconnects and such can (and do) happen causing
the running application to need an ability to check if it
is still the owner of the lock (and react appropriately).

Change-Id: I31a79a093c14c31b47f7f0b2a7bb06d77a793186

subject: Force basepython=python2.7
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-10 07:30:23.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Force basepython=python2.7

launchpadlib 0.0.1.dev533 requires lazr.restfulclient, which contains
python2-only syntax (at least as of lazr.restfulclient 0.13.1).  On a
system where "tox" uses python3 (eg: Debian "stretch"), the default
basepython will be python3, and venv creation (pip building wheels) will
fail on lazr.restfulclient.

This patch forces basepython=python2.7 across all testenvs.

Change-Id: I44f4c6f819550a8a586ae19bbed45fc9b67dd1c0
'}]
commit_message:
Force basepython=python2.7

launchpadlib 0.0.1.dev533 requires lazr.restfulclient, which contains
python2-only syntax (at least as of lazr.restfulclient 0.13.1).  On a
system where "tox" uses python3 (eg: Debian "stretch"), the default
basepython will be python3, and venv creation (pip building wheels) will
fail on lazr.restfulclient.

This patch forces basepython=python2.7 across all testenvs.

Change-Id: I44f4c6f819550a8a586ae19bbed45fc9b67dd1c0

commit_message:
Switch TripleO jobs to F22 jenkins nodes

The non ha job has been tested on F22 and
F21 is going EOL. Also change the number of
F21 and F22 nodes appropriately.

We want to be able to change the section in which an option is
registered in the documentation. This patch uses a <project>.overrides
file to define in which section(s) an option should be moved.

The format of this file is (1 line per option):
[<group>/]<option> <new_group1>[ <new_group2> ... ]

Closes-Bug: #1522794
'}]
commit_message:
[autohelp] allow overrides of sections

We want to be able to change the section in which an option is
registered in the documentation. This patch uses a <project>.overrides
file to define in which section(s) an option should be moved.

The format of this file is (1 line per option):
[<group>/]<option> <new_group1>[ <new_group2> ... ]

Change-Id: I9fd0b763b6e56cd360694566de7f3acc3172c9c1
Closes-Bug: #1522794

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-12-08 20:56:49.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/certificates/common/auth/barbican_acl.py', 'octavia/common/config.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/common/sample_configs/sample_configs.py', 'octavia/common/tls_utils/cert_parser.py', 'octavia/certificates/manager/barbican.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/certificates/common/auth/__init__.py', 'octavia/certificates/manager/local.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/certificates/manager/test_barbican.py', 'etc/octavia.conf', 'octavia/certificates/common/auth/__init__.py', 'octavia/certificates/generator/barbican.py', 'octavia/certificates/manager/cert_mgr.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/certificates/common/test_barbican.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/certificates/manager/test_local.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/common/tls_utils/test_cert_parser.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/certificates/common/auth/test_barbican_acl.py', 'setup.cfg', 'octavia/certificates/common/barbican.py'], 'message': 'Refactor BarbicanAuth to allow for configurable auth method

There is now a new configuration option "barbican_auth" in the
certificates section, to specify which auth plugin to use when
communicating with Barbican. This is because the default option (using
ACLs inside Barbican to control access) should be ok as a default
workflow, but it might be required to use other methods depending on
your deployment. For example, another possible auth method would be
BarbicanTrustAuth, utilizing Keystone Trusts.

Some deployers may need custom auth methods that do not exist in
upstream Keystone, and will need their own Auth plugin. This should be in line
with the way Octavia's network and compute drivers work already.

While we're in this file, prune the unused (and really bad) method that
would *actually* delete certs from Barbican (not in our scope).
Also do the tenant_id -> project_id rename.

Change-Id: Ic9aef68924bb5c216734afd25403e59476c576e7
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor BarbicanAuth to allow for configurable auth method

There is now a new configuration option "barbican_auth" in the
certificates section, to specify which auth plugin to use when
communicating with Barbican. This is because the default option (using
ACLs inside Barbican to control access) should be ok as a default
workflow, but it might be required to use other methods depending on
your deployment. For example, another possible auth method would be
BarbicanTrustAuth, utilizing Keystone Trusts.

Some deployers may need custom auth methods that do not exist in
upstream Keystone, and will need their own Auth plugin. This should be in line
with the way Octavia's network and compute drivers work already.

While we're in this file, prune the unused (and really bad) method that
would *actually* delete certs from Barbican (not in our scope).
Also do the tenant_id -> project_id rename.

Change-Id: Ic9aef68924bb5c216734afd25403e59476c576e7

When AMQPDestinationNotFound is raised, we must not
call the error_callback method. The exception is logged
only if needed in upper layer (amqpdriver.py).

Related-bug: #1524418

Change-Id: Ic1ddec2d13172532dbaa572d04a4c22c97ac4fe7
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trigger error_callback for known exc

When AMQPDestinationNotFound is raised, we must not
call the error_callback method. The exception is logged
only if needed in upper layer (amqpdriver.py).

URI for POST Trust API is not correct - it should be /v3/OS-TRUST/trusts

commit_message:
Fix Keystone Identity V3 Trust API URL

URI for POST Trust API is not correct - it should be /v3/OS-TRUST/trusts

http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v3-ext.html#createTrust

Now Tempest is using these ref as Documents for their service client and
found this issue.

Change-Id: I80a8d7df769fe9e767859462eee31e2f86f60026
Closes-Bug: #1524585

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-09 15:49:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/client.py'], 'message': "Allow passing version as '2' as well as '2.0'

Currently python-neutronclient and python-openstackclient have different
views of what OS_NETWORK_API_VERSION should be. Rather than fighting a
land war, how about we make both things accept both things, since it's
generally understandable by humans that '2' and '2.0' are the same
thing.

Change-Id: Ibf3c14e15b19c1aca696ce5c693588565a73a524
"}]
commit_message:
Allow passing version as '2' as well as '2.0'

Currently python-neutronclient and python-openstackclient have different
views of what OS_NETWORK_API_VERSION should be. Rather than fighting a
land war, how about we make both things accept both things, since it's
generally understandable by humans that '2' and '2.0' are the same
thing.

Change-Id: Ibf3c14e15b19c1aca696ce5c693588565a73a524

commit_message:
Correct DHCP configuration examples

The intermediate chain loader URL, for our TFTP configuration
requires a leading / to match the file in order to serve up the
user's request.

Added leading "/" to the configuration examples.

Closes-Bug: #1524505

commit_message:
Remove local copy of api doc

The Senlin API doc is now contributed to api-site project, and it is
online here: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-clustering-v1.html.
We don't need to maintain a local copy of it.

Change-Id: I048dd4230fd111dfbaaebf1994b38491b8661f29

commit_message:
Make v2 create_user_ec2_credentials  use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes create_user_ec2_credentials of v2 identity_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I84b62041ee5e3811e9651ece2323b1f52065ff91

subject: Call _persist_state for UPDATE in 'state_set'
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 7404, 'name': 'Ethan Lynn', 'email': 'xuanlangjian@gmail.com', 'username': 'GaryLynn'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-09 13:13:38.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Call _persist_state for UPDATE in 'state_set'

UPDATE flow doesn't call 'state_set', to set the state.
However, this is called in 'set_stack_and_resource_to_failed',
to set the stack status to FAILED. This includes reset during
stack UPDATE.

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245810/5, we removed UPDATE
from persisting the state as part of releasing the lock. This has
resulted in the state not being persisted for UPDATE when
'reset_stack_status' is called.

Change-Id: I8a80e329604fdec6498acca0a71723100d412384
Closes-Bug: #1523717
"}]
commit_message:
Call _persist_state for UPDATE in 'state_set'

UPDATE flow doesn't call 'state_set', to set the state.
However, this is called in 'set_stack_and_resource_to_failed',
to set the stack status to FAILED. This includes reset during
stack UPDATE.

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245810/5, we removed UPDATE
from persisting the state as part of releasing the lock. This has
resulted in the state not being persisted for UPDATE when
'reset_stack_status' is called.

Change-Id: I8a80e329604fdec6498acca0a71723100d412384
Closes-Bug: #1523717

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute volumes_client

Compute volumes_client has been migrated to
tempest-lib- I10913f82dc3d0bef53edd67144cb47580d3c574d

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commit makes Tempest to use compute volumes_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I9909c96d6f7003a09f7694b1b1d7feac894b998f

Change-Id: I3257acec07d0b62186fdcc27375f8237d1f0d2cc

commit_message:
Add Rally benchmarking hooks to Dragonflow

Once a rally job is configured in project-config, the
dragonflow.yaml file and scenarios will run in the gate
with Dragonflow as a plugin.
It is easy to extend and add new rally plugins and scenarios
in this repository to be used.

Change-Id: I3257acec07d0b62186fdcc27375f8237d1f0d2cc

revisions:

This patch move some logic to manager layer, so that endpoints

in catalog when issue a project scoped token and using
`endpoint_filter.sql` as catalog's backend driver.

This make sure that call `list_endpoints_for_project` API has

Change-Id: I56f4eb6fc524650677b627295dd4338d55164c39
Closes-Bug: #1516469

commit_message:
Ensure endpoints returned is filtered correctly

This patch move some logic to manager layer, so that endpoints
filtered by endpoint_group project association will be included
in catalog when issue a project scoped token and using
`endpoint_filter.sql` as catalog's backend driver.

This make sure that call `list_endpoints_for_project` API has
the same endpoints with that in catalog returned for project
scoped token.

Change-Id: I56f4eb6fc524650677b627295dd4338d55164c39
Closes-Bug: #1516469

the @mock.patch accordingly when running in Python3.x.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-06 08:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/common/utils.py', 'senlinclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Add get_file support for senlinclient

SenlinClient should support get_file in spec.
Like following:

type: os.heat.stack
version: 1.0
properties:
  name: random_string_stack
  template:
    get_file: random_string_stack.yaml
  context:
    region_name: RegionOne
  environment:
    - get_file: env.yaml

Change-Id: I7076bdaa1bdb225171b18491c4e521ef6e7b94ae
Closes-Bug: #1510376
'}]
commit_message:
Add get_file support for senlinclient

SenlinClient should support get_file in spec.
Like following:

type: os.heat.stack
version: 1.0
properties:
  name: random_string_stack
  template:
    get_file: random_string_stack.yaml
  context:
    region_name: RegionOne
  environment:
    - get_file: env.yaml

Change-Id: I7076bdaa1bdb225171b18491c4e521ef6e7b94ae
Closes-Bug: #1510376

subject: Shorten the event ID in log output for reability
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-09 14:17:49.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/event.py'], 'message': 'Shorten the event ID in log output for reability

The current event log output contains a long event ID that is rarely
helpful in distinguishing events from each other. This patch proposes
logging the "short ID" of the object.

Change-Id: Ie78b4c6f0a97d9f7330ccf2e3de3455acd8b1308
'}]
commit_message:
Shorten the event ID in log output for reability

The current event log output contains a long event ID that is rarely
helpful in distinguishing events from each other. This patch proposes
logging the "short ID" of the object.

Change-Id: Ie78b4c6f0a97d9f7330ccf2e3de3455acd8b1308

The default logging output from functional test is too verbose to find
any useful information. This patch tries to raise the logging level so
that only useful information from the engine or the api are logged.

Change-Id: Ie68f5a752a87cf277e7fbccc01455dd121f186a5
'}]
commit_message:
Improve logging in functional testings

The default logging output from functional test is too verbose to find
any useful information. This patch tries to raise the logging level so
that only useful information from the engine or the api are logged.

Change-Id: Ie68f5a752a87cf277e7fbccc01455dd121f186a5

For Mitaka, neutron implements automatic generation of sample
configuration files and removes static sample configuration
files from the neutron source tree. Therefore, the
configuration reference must include local versions of

implement automatic generation of sample configuration files.

Change-Id: If92d048a837ffbd9ba8664559ddabe886f448a32
Closes-Bug: #1520722

commit_message:
[config-ref] Include neutron config files

For Mitaka, neutron implements automatic generation of sample
configuration files and removes static sample configuration
files from the neutron source tree. Therefore, the
configuration reference must include local versions of
sample configuration files similar to other projects that
implement automatic generation of sample configuration files.

Change-Id: If92d048a837ffbd9ba8664559ddabe886f448a32
Closes-Bug: #1520722

Require operator specify swiftinit provider
on supported components rather then pass it through.

commit_message:
Import i18n functions directly

Import i18n functions from module directly and do not use
global module variables like _ = i18n._. It makes code shorter
and cleaner. It also to detect cases when these functions are not
used in module.

Change-Id: Iaa593ac1f2dd15cbcad049bef6ba68f1cfa610da

from commit 2ee08c3464c53abaf9bc5493132ad7958611e3b8

commit_message:
Notify about port create/update unconditionally

The notification about port create/update should be done no matter
if host (or any other field) was changed or not - it should be up to
handler to decide how to handle it.

This also fixes the bug when there was actually no notification to l3
dvr agent on compute node on new port creation:
_get_host_port_if_changed() always returned None - this is a regression
from commit 2ee08c3464c53abaf9bc5493132ad7958611e3b8

Closes-Bug: #1521524
Change-Id: I5bb416d2aaab632526f06a5620c0a4ea96340d21
(cherry picked from commit 87ce73141dddb840ffc523f253fdf87aef11d1c7)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-02 17:19:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/cmd/rtstool.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cmd.py'], 'message': 'LIO: Handle initiator IQNs as case insensitive

If there is a mismatch in case between the stored
initiator IQN in the LIO ACL vs. the IQN provided
in a later call, rtstool would fail to find the
existing ACL.

Compare IQNs in a case insensitive manner to ensure
they will always match as intended.  (Refer to RFC
3720 section 3.2.6.1 for details on this.)

Closes-Bug: #1522053

Change-Id: I6f535f3f4fbfcbbb49da30cffb08d17b3cac778a
'}]
commit_message:
LIO: Handle initiator IQNs as case insensitive

If there is a mismatch in case between the stored
initiator IQN in the LIO ACL vs. the IQN provided
in a later call, rtstool would fail to find the
existing ACL.

Compare IQNs in a case insensitive manner to ensure
they will always match as intended.  (Refer to RFC
3720 section 3.2.6.1 for details on this.)

Closes-Bug: #1522053

Change-Id: I6f535f3f4fbfcbbb49da30cffb08d17b3cac778a

commit_message:
Add libvirt-python to ceilometer hosts

Ceilometer utilizes the libvirt library for gathering
instance related metrics. This commit adds the package
to the ceilometer hosts.

Change-Id: I1e46a9a49b606e11cd12f06ce947990096b1ad08
Closes-Bug: #1522250
(cherry picked from commit edf69b4969d7c3bf98db358b7a2c7894e5c4113a)

subject: Use project throughout openrc
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-12 23:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['openrc'], 'message': 'Use project throughout openrc

This is less ambitious than trying to convert the entire world to use v3
authentication. For now simply replace OS_TENANT_NAME with OS_PROJECT_NAME
because all the CLIs should be able to handle that by now.

Change-Id: If473b2eb74d26afa5ff22b7ab6afca25878b923e
'}]
commit_message:
Use project throughout openrc

This is less ambitious than trying to convert the entire world to use v3
authentication. For now simply replace OS_TENANT_NAME with OS_PROJECT_NAME
because all the CLIs should be able to handle that by now.

commit_message:
Allow saving and caching the plugin auth state

Particularly for allowing the CLI to store and reuse previous
authentication allow an application to extract and reinstall the
auth state from a plugin.

Implements: bp cachable-auth

commit_message:
Use certmonger for certs

Replace custom openssl certificate generation with calls to the
certmonger local CA. Ideally we would use the certmaster backend for
devstack however it lacks some features we require.

Change-Id: Ib0164bb27233e2b67b1580ce350a5ea9e4330834

commit_message:
Fix decription for admins Image create modal

Current admins image create modal
description/helpbox contains inaccurate
description.
Glance can store compressed images, but
Nova can't boot from compressed images.
This patch deletes mentioning compressed
images as supported type for admin
page.

Change-Id: I1e8972688d096692c6746f7a2f4a2dcf71ffabbf
Partial-Bug: #1479966
Co-Authored-By: Alan Fung<wingfung@cisco.com>

subject: Statically handle default auth options
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-13 04:29:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'openstackclient/api/auth.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_clientmanager.py', 'openstackclient/identity/client.py'], 'message': "Statically handle default auth options

Don't compile all the possible auth options for everything on the system
into the --help text of OSC. Keystoneclient handles this by only
registering the options specified in --os-auth-plugin. Do something
similar for OSC and make it so that if the user doesn't provide a plugin
we handle the options manually so we don't get messed up by plugins that
do weird things.

Change-Id: I609204172deacd76bde7edbd5096aee310eeb716
"}]
commit_message:
Statically handle default auth options

Don't compile all the possible auth options for everything on the system
into the --help text of OSC. Keystoneclient handles this by only
registering the options specified in --os-auth-plugin. Do something
similar for OSC and make it so that if the user doesn't provide a plugin
we handle the options manually so we don't get messed up by plugins that
do weird things.

Change-Id: I609204172deacd76bde7edbd5096aee310eeb716

subject: Load auth plugins directly
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-13 04:29:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/api/auth.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_clientmanager.py', 'examples/common.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Load auth plugins directly

There is no need for OSC to determine a plugin name and then look that
up in stevedore. If it knows the plugin it wants then it should access
it directly. This means we don't add new plugins to the global stevedore
pool because these plugins are available to everything on the system.

Centralize all the hacks for loading these plugins. It's a big function
but now there is one place where you give some options and you get back
a plugin. This will make it easier to refactor later where we have the
same pattern.

Change-Id: I44f720cf43f6a7d0a19a10760a0f63e1a48af09e
"}]
commit_message:
Load auth plugins directly

There is no need for OSC to determine a plugin name and then look that
up in stevedore. If it knows the plugin it wants then it should access
it directly. This means we don't add new plugins to the global stevedore
pool because these plugins are available to everything on the system.

Centralize all the hacks for loading these plugins. It's a big function
but now there is one place where you give some options and you get back
a plugin. This will make it easier to refactor later where we have the
same pattern.

Change-Id: I44f720cf43f6a7d0a19a10760a0f63e1a48af09e

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-28 23:37:13.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/image/client.py', 'examples/object_api.py', 'examples/osc-lib.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_clientmanager.py', 'examples/common.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': "Use keystoneclient's session loading from CLI

The keystoneclient provides a standard mechanism for loading transport
options from a CLI. This will remove some handling from OSC as well as
give it the ability to specify client certificates.

This removes the verify parameter from the ClientManager as this is an
option that is handled by the session loading mechanism. The verify
argument that is not provided by keystoneclient is mapped to the
insecure parameter that is.

Change-Id: I7deb0489c6237465608521d8750fbca2ea24aa65
"}]
commit_message:
Use keystoneclient's session loading from CLI

The keystoneclient provides a standard mechanism for loading transport
options from a CLI. This will remove some handling from OSC as well as
give it the ability to specify client certificates.

This removes the verify parameter from the ClientManager as this is an
option that is handled by the session loading mechanism. The verify
argument that is not provided by keystoneclient is mapped to the
insecure parameter that is.

Change-Id: I7deb0489c6237465608521d8750fbca2ea24aa65

commit_message:
Add "vnc" option group for sample nova.conf file

There is no "[vnc]" section in nova.conf.sample generated by
command "tox -egenconfig".
In addition, the "[default]" section has vnc options.

This patch moves vnc options from "[default]" section to
"[vnc]" section.

Change-Id: I5cf69729aa9e2bb868f26b82eaaa28187ce7a7a3
Closes-Bug: #1506356

commit_message:
Move consistency group quota checks to API

Currently quotas are sometimes checked in cinder.volume.manager,
and other times checked in cinder.volume.api. This patch is the
second of two commits that aim to make these checks more consistent
by moving calls from the manager to the API. This way, we can give
the user feedback before launching the RPC call. If the quotas fail
to update, an exception will be raised in the API to inform the user
before the action takes place unless the force option is set to True.

APIImpact
Closes-bug: #1508249
Depends-On: I49e3e2bf3e1621e9e8d9645b7ad09154ffb448c3
Change-Id: I081b4172d0c57f20239ace2ec3f2c16bb19d3d9b

The existing openrc file download only works for keystone v2. Regardless
of whether v3 is enabled in Horizon.

This adds support for both. A v2.0 and a v3 compatible openrc file
download. A couple of different situations are covered.

1) support for keystone v2 only: OPENSTACK_API_VERSION={'identity': 2.0}
In this case only the v2 option is shown.

2) Use of keystone v3 in a potentially mixed environment. Since it is
possible to use keystone v2 and v3 in the same enviroment, having
OPENSTACK_API_VERSION={'identity': 3} displays options for downloading
v2 or v3 compatible openrc files.

Rationale for making the existing methods and urls support v3+. By
moving the v2.0 functionality to new version specific methods, they can
be more easily excised when v2 is obsolete and we're left with the newer
version support.

Change-Id: I29c62dc7436cc39adc1a4af9d90ceb6767e7a177
Closes-Bug: #1460150
"}]
commit_message:
Adding download for openrc file for keystone v3

The existing openrc file download only works for keystone v2. Regardless
of whether v3 is enabled in Horizon.

This adds support for both. A v2.0 and a v3 compatible openrc file
download. A couple of different situations are covered.

1) support for keystone v2 only: OPENSTACK_API_VERSION={'identity': 2.0}
In this case only the v2 option is shown.

2) Use of keystone v3 in a potentially mixed environment. Since it is
possible to use keystone v2 and v3 in the same enviroment, having
OPENSTACK_API_VERSION={'identity': 3} displays options for downloading
v2 or v3 compatible openrc files.

Rationale for making the existing methods and urls support v3+. By
moving the v2.0 functionality to new version specific methods, they can
be more easily excised when v2 is obsolete and we're left with the newer
version support.

Change-Id: I29c62dc7436cc39adc1a4af9d90ceb6767e7a177
Closes-Bug: #1460150

commit_message:
Use assertDictEqual instead of assertEqualPolicies

The assertEqualPolicies methods was recently refactored
(I7b6ec22430fcffae69cab1b276e41390314be5cc) to only call assertDictEqual. This
change removes assertEqualPolicies in place of assertDictEqual, resulting in
clearer code.

Change-Id: I4c675bac5f6cadff018e5d7d2f689d21b3e504ce

commit_message:
Improve startup performance of nova-compute Hyper-V driver

During the nova-compute driver startup, a lot of calls are made to
get_windows_version slowing down startup.
This patch speeds up the startup by caching the windows version to
be used for later calls of get_windows_version.

Change-Id: I5b2eadc0bce79cd261a5dcaac7712c23c49dfcc2

commit_message:
Improve startup performance of nova-compute Hyper-V driver

During the nova-compute driver startup, a lot of calls are made to
get_windows_version slowing down startup.
This patch speeds up the startup by caching the windows version to
be used for later calls of get_windows_version.

Change-Id: Ie555088abe20c2c6dcb8340dd61745f710a0323e

commit_message:
Automatically generate neutron LBaaS configuration files

This adds a new tox environment, genconfig, which generates sample
neutron LBaaS configuration file using oslo-config-generator.

DocImpact: Update the docs that LBaaS no longer includes static example
configuration files. Instead, use tools/generate_config_file_samples.sh
to generate them and the files generated now end with .sample extension.

Partially-Implements: blueprint autogen-neutron-conf-file

Change-Id: I25507f3bc6e995580aa91a912c2cf4110757df15
Partial-bug: #1199963

commit_message:
Avoid to use common.cert_manager directly

Conductor has a utility to manage bay specific certificates.
This patch changes to use it.
And also this patch fixes temporary place holder classes related
to bp:objects-from-bay.

Change-Id: I55d7fe33d7a910b9ba76bcbb4c39353fe7fac2f4
Closes-Bug: #1523843

commit_message:
Fix neutron issue w/ l2pop

This change resolves an issue where neutron is not able to bind to
a given port because l2 population is disabled and no vxlan multicast
group has been defined. To resolve this the `neutron_l2_population`
variable is being defined and set to "False" in the os_neutron defaults
and the vxlan multicast group will now contain a default value instead
of an empty string.

The change also removes the neutron_l2_population checks in the tasks
and templates because the variable is now being defined.

Change-Id: Ic2973626d88781bfc67a4275afcf9feffeb63f36
Closes-Bug: #1521793
Co-Authored-by: Ville Vuorinen <ville.vuorinen@multim.fi>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix mesos monitor for handling multiple masters
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-08 15:27:32.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/conductor/test_monitors.py', 'magnum/conductor/mesos_monitor.py'], 'message': 'Fix mesos monitor for handling multiple masters

Magnum is going to enable HA mode for mesos bay, in which there
could be more than one master nodes. One of the master node (leader)
is active and the rest of them is not active. Mesos monitor needs to
identify the leader and pull metrics from the leader only.

Change-Id: Ic7d6cb64964db2758163bd231dec4190302155b2
Partial-Implements: blueprint mesos-multi-master-node
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mesos monitor for handling multiple masters

Magnum is going to enable HA mode for mesos bay, in which there
could be more than one master nodes. One of the master node (leader)
is active and the rest of them is not active. Mesos monitor needs to
identify the leader and pull metrics from the leader only.

Change-Id: Ic7d6cb64964db2758163bd231dec4190302155b2
Partial-Implements: blueprint mesos-multi-master-node

subject: Rename analyzer/builder functions/methods
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-04 02:14:24.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/builder.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/analyzer.py'], 'message': "Rename analyzer/builder functions/methods

Some of the names are 'iter_*' and others are 'iterate_*'
so this just rename the 'iter_*' to be 'iterate_*' and also
hides a couple of analyzer methods that are not used
externally (and really don't need to be exposed).

commit_message:
Rename analyzer/builder functions/methods

Some of the names are 'iter_*' and others are 'iterate_*'
so this just rename the 'iter_*' to be 'iterate_*' and also
hides a couple of analyzer methods that are not used
externally (and really don't need to be exposed).

Change-Id: Ibd5180a0cf2b40d914cd668137473d1fbab445cd

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 12:11:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_xtremio.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/xtremio.py'], 'message': "Take into consideration races in XtremIOClient3

When working with FC and xtremio is using XtremIOClient3 on FC's
terminate_connection we can get VolumeBackendAPIException saying a
resource could not be found when we shouldn't.

The cause is that Client3 is open to race conditions on 2 methods,
find_lunmap and num_of_mapped_volumes, where a list of mappings is first
retrieved and then we iterate this list to retrieved additional info on
the mappings.

The race would happen if one of the mappings is removed from the backend
in the time it takes to retrieve the additional info after we have
retrieved the list.

This patch fixes this issue by ignoring any mappings that have been
removed and are now NotFound when retrieving additional information for
a mapping in those 2 methods.

This patch also fixes this kind of race problems on volume creation
since it uses find_lumap method.

Closes-Bug: #1521143
Change-Id: I40831e04093ff475395870a333211dd0cb60440f
(cherry picked from commit 89480f159231eae154119da6b46432849b9df20a)
"}]
commit_message:
Take into consideration races in XtremIOClient3

When working with FC and xtremio is using XtremIOClient3 on FC's
terminate_connection we can get VolumeBackendAPIException saying a
resource could not be found when we shouldn't.

The cause is that Client3 is open to race conditions on 2 methods,
find_lunmap and num_of_mapped_volumes, where a list of mappings is first
retrieved and then we iterate this list to retrieved additional info on
the mappings.

The race would happen if one of the mappings is removed from the backend
in the time it takes to retrieve the additional info after we have
retrieved the list.

This patch fixes this issue by ignoring any mappings that have been
removed and are now NotFound when retrieving additional information for
a mapping in those 2 methods.

This patch also fixes this kind of race problems on volume creation
since it uses find_lumap method.

Closes-Bug: #1521143
Change-Id: I40831e04093ff475395870a333211dd0cb60440f
(cherry picked from commit 89480f159231eae154119da6b46432849b9df20a)

commit_message:
Remove unfixable FIXME

There is a note in test_catalog.py saying that we should fix the
endpoint create status code from 200 OK to 201 Created.

This isn't allowed according to the API working group guidelines:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/evaluating_api_changes.html#evaluating-api-changes

Change-Id: Id52c61f119d4e9b1168ddc2d1ebc760fca1d640d

subject: Put part-replicas where they go
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 995, 'name': 'David Goetz', 'email': 'david.goetz@rackspace.com', 'username': 'david-goetz'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 5600, 'name': 'Brian Cline', 'email': 'bcline@softlayer.com', 'username': 'briancline'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7134, 'name': 'Lorcan Browne', 'email': 'lorcan.browne@hp.com', 'username': 'brownelo'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 12050, 'name': 'Charles Hsu', 'email': 'charles0126@gmail.com', 'username': 'charz'}, {'_account_id': 12193, 'name': 'Hisashi Osanai', 'email': 'osanai.hisashi@jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'ho'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18015, 'name': 'Peter LisÃ¡k', 'email': 'peter.lisak@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter.lisak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-08 00:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/ring/builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_utils.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_ring.py', 'swift/cli/ringbuilder.py'], 'message': 'Put part-replicas where they go

It's harder than it sounds.  There was really three challenges.

Challenge #1 Initial Assignment
===============================

Before starting to assign parts on this new shiny ring you've
constructed, maybe we'll pause for a moment up front and consider the
lay of the land.  This process is called the replica_plan.

The replica_plan approach is separating part assignment failures into
two modes:

 1) we considered the cluster topology and it's weights and came up with
    the wrong plan

 2) we failed to execute on the plan

I failed at both parts plenty of times before I got it this close.  I'm
sure a counter example still exists, but when we find it the new helper
methods will let us reason about where things went wrong.

Challenge #2 Fixing Placement
=============================

With a sound plan in hand, it's much easier to fail to execute on it the
less material you have to execute with - so we gather up as many parts
as we can - as long as we think we can find them a better home.

Picking the right parts for gather is a black art - when you notice a
balance is slow it's because it's spending so much time iterating over
replica2part2dev trying to decide just the right parts to gather.

The replica plan can help at least in the gross dispersion collection to
gather up the worst offenders first before considering balance.  I think
trying to avoid picking up parts that are stuck to the tier before
falling into a forced grab on anything over parts_wanted helps with
stability generally - but depending on where the parts_wanted are in
relation to the full devices it's pretty easy pick up something that'll
end up really close to where it started.

I tried to break the gather methods into smaller pieces so it looked
like I knew what I was doing.

Going with a MAXIMUM gather iteration instead of balance (which doesn't
reflect the replica_plan) doesn't seem to be costing me anything - most
of the time the exit condition is either solved or all the parts overly
aggressively locked up on min_part_hours.  So far, it mostly seemds if
the thing is going to balance this round it'll get it in the first
couple of shakes.

Challenge #3 Crazy replica2part2dev tables
==========================================

I think there's lots of ways "scars" can build up a ring which can
result in very particular replica2part2dev tables that are physically
difficult to dig out of.  It's repairing these scars that will take
multiple rebalances to resolve.

... but at this point ...

... lacking a counter example ...

I've been able to close up all the edge cases I was able to find.  It
may not be quick, but progress will be made.

Basically my strategy just required a better understanding of how
previous algorithms were able to *mostly* keep things moving by brute
forcing the whole mess with a bunch of randomness.  Then when we detect
our "elegant" careful part selection isn't making progress - we can fall
back to same old tricks.

Validation
==========

We validate against duplicate part replica assignment after rebalance
and raise an ERROR if we detect more than one replica of a part assigned
to the same device.

In order to meet that requirement we have to have as many devices as
replicas, so attempting to rebalance with too few devices w/o changing
your replica_count is also an ERROR not a warning.

Random Thoughts
===============

As usual with rings, the test diff can be hard to reason about -
hopefully I've added enough comments to assure future me that these
assertions make sense.

Despite being a large rewrite of a lot of important code, the existing
code is known to have failed us.  This change fixes a critical bug that's
trivial to reproduce in a critical component of the system.

There's probably a bunch of error messages and exit status stuff that's
not as helpful as it could be considering the new behaviors.

Change-Id: I1bbe7be38806fc1c8b9181a722933c18a6c76e05
Closes-Bug: #1452431
'}]
commit_message:
Put part-replicas where they go

It's harder than it sounds.  There was really three challenges.

Challenge #1 Initial Assignment
===============================

Before starting to assign parts on this new shiny ring you've
constructed, maybe we'll pause for a moment up front and consider the
lay of the land.  This process is called the replica_plan.

The replica_plan approach is separating part assignment failures into
two modes:

 1) we considered the cluster topology and it's weights and came up with
    the wrong plan

 2) we failed to execute on the plan

I failed at both parts plenty of times before I got it this close.  I'm
sure a counter example still exists, but when we find it the new helper
methods will let us reason about where things went wrong.

Challenge #2 Fixing Placement
=============================

With a sound plan in hand, it's much easier to fail to execute on it the
less material you have to execute with - so we gather up as many parts
as we can - as long as we think we can find them a better home.

Picking the right parts for gather is a black art - when you notice a
balance is slow it's because it's spending so much time iterating over
replica2part2dev trying to decide just the right parts to gather.

The replica plan can help at least in the gross dispersion collection to
gather up the worst offenders first before considering balance.  I think
trying to avoid picking up parts that are stuck to the tier before
falling into a forced grab on anything over parts_wanted helps with
stability generally - but depending on where the parts_wanted are in
relation to the full devices it's pretty easy pick up something that'll
end up really close to where it started.

I tried to break the gather methods into smaller pieces so it looked
like I knew what I was doing.

Going with a MAXIMUM gather iteration instead of balance (which doesn't
reflect the replica_plan) doesn't seem to be costing me anything - most
of the time the exit condition is either solved or all the parts overly
aggressively locked up on min_part_hours.  So far, it mostly seemds if
the thing is going to balance this round it'll get it in the first
couple of shakes.

Challenge #3 Crazy replica2part2dev tables
==========================================

I think there's lots of ways "scars" can build up a ring which can
result in very particular replica2part2dev tables that are physically
difficult to dig out of.  It's repairing these scars that will take
multiple rebalances to resolve.

... but at this point ...

... lacking a counter example ...

I've been able to close up all the edge cases I was able to find.  It
may not be quick, but progress will be made.

Basically my strategy just required a better understanding of how
previous algorithms were able to *mostly* keep things moving by brute
forcing the whole mess with a bunch of randomness.  Then when we detect
our "elegant" careful part selection isn't making progress - we can fall
back to same old tricks.

Validation
==========

We validate against duplicate part replica assignment after rebalance
and raise an ERROR if we detect more than one replica of a part assigned
to the same device.

In order to meet that requirement we have to have as many devices as
replicas, so attempting to rebalance with too few devices w/o changing
your replica_count is also an ERROR not a warning.

Random Thoughts
===============

As usual with rings, the test diff can be hard to reason about -
hopefully I've added enough comments to assure future me that these
assertions make sense.

Despite being a large rewrite of a lot of important code, the existing
code is known to have failed us.  This change fixes a critical bug that's
trivial to reproduce in a critical component of the system.

There's probably a bunch of error messages and exit status stuff that's
not as helpful as it could be considering the new behaviors.

Change-Id: I1bbe7be38806fc1c8b9181a722933c18a6c76e05
Closes-Bug: #1452431

commit_message:
Scheduler: honor the glance metadata for hypervisor details

The scheduler would not honor the glance image metadata for
'hypervisor_type' and 'hypervisor_version_requires'. This was due
to the fact that this was not part if the image_meta object.

Change-Id: I03742cc9330814e2758184d8189a5be93a2b978b
Closes-bug: #1523503
(cherry picked from commit f33dfa0647f0cd289bce19f7c06b3d0a88070a92)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6589, 'name': 'Jesse Keating', 'email': 'jkeating@j2solutions.net', 'username': 'jesse-keating'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 16687, 'name': 'Shu Shen', 'email': 'shu.shen@gmail.com', 'username': 'shushen'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-10 00:51:03.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/images.py', 'glanceclient/common/http.py'], 'message': 'Convert headers to lower-case when parsing metadata

In urllib3 1.11.0 (and consequently, requests 2.8.0) handling was added
to preserve the casing of headers as they arrived over the wire. This
means that when iterating over a CaseInsensitiveDict from requests (as
we do in _image_meta_from_headers) we no longer get keys that are
already all lowercase. As a result, we need to ensure that the header
key is lowercased before checking its properties.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Lewis <stevelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I61d73763a2cc42f9af8df972095afa8e3c5e8267
Closes-bug: #1476770
'}]
commit_message:
Convert headers to lower-case when parsing metadata

In urllib3 1.11.0 (and consequently, requests 2.8.0) handling was added
to preserve the casing of headers as they arrived over the wire. This
means that when iterating over a CaseInsensitiveDict from requests (as
we do in _image_meta_from_headers) we no longer get keys that are
already all lowercase. As a result, we need to ensure that the header
key is lowercased before checking its properties.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Lewis <stevelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I61d73763a2cc42f9af8df972095afa8e3c5e8267
Closes-bug: #1476770

commit_message:
Create V9 Role Driver

In preparation for new role driver methods for implied roles, this
patch creates a new version of the role driver.

Partially Implements@ blueprint implied-roles

Change-Id: I00cc57a77a23ed30d86fce8e309f6b27c4ae26a1

commit_message:
Create new version of assignment driver interface

In preparation for removing a series of driver methods in
the rationalization of assignment in follow-on patches, we
first create a V9 version of the driver interface. In this
patch, both V8 and V9 are identical.

To create the new V9 driver we:

1) Copy the sql V8 driver into its own directory to provide a
test for support of a legacy driver
2) Increase the version of the (new) standard driver to V9
3) Create a wrapper for V8 legacy drivers, so that the latest
manager can be driver version-less
4) Create tests that run the standard sql Identity tests
against the V8 driver to show, going forward, it is still working.
Since our existing test strategy assumes that we never change the
sqlalchemy models during a test run, this turned out to be slight
more complex than anticipated - so a new tox envlist target for legacy
drivers is added.

Partially Implements: blueprint assignment-manager-cleanup
Change-Id: Iefa13b64084b8e71c881ae08e1ec434d24756c17

subject: export DATABASES_TO_SAVE for save-state
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-28 00:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['inc/upgrade'], 'message': 'export DATABASES_TO_SAVE for save-state

I noticed this in I45894911c0ee9cd6c9b142d6192350269873d82f where the
"old" database isn't dumped.  This seems to be because "save-state"
calls inc/upgrade:save_mysql_dbs, but it doesn't have access to
DATABASES_TO_SAVE because it's not exported.  An additional trick is
that save-state includes inc/upgrade, so be sure not to overwrite the
variable as blank.

Depends-On: I45894911c0ee9cd6c9b142d6192350269873d82f
Change-Id: I49626dcc277497eaf66d4d998ba8b2655293d28f
'}]
commit_message:
export DATABASES_TO_SAVE for save-state

I noticed this in I45894911c0ee9cd6c9b142d6192350269873d82f where the
"old" database isn't dumped.  This seems to be because "save-state"
calls inc/upgrade:save_mysql_dbs, but it doesn't have access to
DATABASES_TO_SAVE because it's not exported.  An additional trick is
that save-state includes inc/upgrade, so be sure not to overwrite the
variable as blank.

Depends-On: I45894911c0ee9cd6c9b142d6192350269873d82f
Change-Id: I49626dcc277497eaf66d4d998ba8b2655293d28f

subject: Remove exposure of routers at package level
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-03 18:08:21.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/resource/__init__.py', 'keystone/identity/__init__.py', 'keystone/token/__init__.py', 'keystone/version/service.py', 'keystone/oauth1/__init__.py', 'keystone/revoke/__init__.py', 'keystone/federation/__init__.py', 'keystone/trust/__init__.py', 'keystone/policy/__init__.py', 'keystone/endpoint_policy/__init__.py', 'keystone/credential/__init__.py', 'keystone/assignment/__init__.py', 'keystone/auth/__init__.py', 'keystone/catalog/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Remove exposure of routers at package level

Keystone API routers are exposed at their package
level (in __init__.py files). This causes them to
be unnecessarily executed each time something
whithin that package is used.

For example, simply importing
keystone.federation.constants would make the
federation routers code to be executed.

This patch remove routers exposure from package
level and import them directly in services.py,
which is the single place that needs them.

Change-Id: If68184c871ac77659ad2e64aa5f0aafac7a4bf70
'}]
commit_message:
Remove exposure of routers at package level

Keystone API routers are exposed at their package
level (in __init__.py files). This causes them to
be unnecessarily executed each time something
whithin that package is used.

For example, simply importing
keystone.federation.constants would make the
federation routers code to be executed.

This patch remove routers exposure from package
level and import them directly in services.py,
which is the single place that needs them.

Change-Id: If68184c871ac77659ad2e64aa5f0aafac7a4bf70

Remove invalid TODO related to bug 1265071

There is a TODO note at the SQL catalog backend
saying that not all SQL entities should require
an 'extra' attribute. This is reported as bug
1265071.

This patch removes that note, since the bug has
now been fixed.

Related-Bug: #1265071

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "OVS agent reacts to events instead of polling""

The original change had to be reverted because it caused
tests failing in the gate. The failures were due to the
fact that when a port was not ready, an exception was
thrown to trigger a full resync of the agent. This
behavior was meant to be temporary and was fixed in a
dependent patch that was not merged though. This revert
moves the handling of not ready ports in this patch.
It also refactors the unit tests a bit.

This reverts commit e7270d9505fe09ec6d687e7796a814bf883b5416.

Change-Id: I6574cef3c95525ace6a98cf968ee159190681394

commit_message:
Fix stats bug for start_time = 1970-01-01

The api was incorrectly omitting the time
in the where clause if the value was 0, so
check for None instead.

Change-Id: Ic7c225924efce42aae21eb4a909fb877fa6b171f

commit_message:
Add persistence to the RequestSpec object

In order to use the request spec for an instance boot during later
scheduling operations, like resize/migrate, it needs to be persisted.
This adds a db migration to store the request spec and methods to the
object to create/save/get the request spec.

The RequestSpec object is also important for cells v2 so that boot
requests can have their information persisted before the creation of an
instance record in the database.

Change-Id: I94cd50ad29e10eb320d1d78f3081db6519815ff9
Implements: bp persist-request-spec

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-12-10 11:12:05.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo-template.rst'], 'message': "Clarify when the blueprint should be created

Several commenters on Id9addc65f0d2ed519ce4b3edbd561ed660a2786e have
been confused by the fact that the spec includes a reference to a
launchpad blueprint URL that doesn't exist.

This is even more confusing for reviewers of changes like
I9649ee74ebaf62b6b929b28243a07c789a08867c which reference the
blueprint URL as an explanation of why the change is being made - when
the link is broken reviewers have no context that lets them evaluate
the change.

To prevent this being a problem, I've added a note to template.rst
explaining that the blueprint should be created early, and have a
pointer to the change so that reviewers can follow the progress of the
spec.

This change is not itself a spec; it's a change to the process of
creating specs; but I feel as though the same approval process we use
for specs would make sense to use for changing the we suggest creating
specs.

Change-Id: I57bf5e0d73c63120259973515ea26593a2776ba2
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify when the blueprint should be created

Several commenters on Id9addc65f0d2ed519ce4b3edbd561ed660a2786e have
been confused by the fact that the spec includes a reference to a
launchpad blueprint URL that doesn't exist.

This is even more confusing for reviewers of changes like
I9649ee74ebaf62b6b929b28243a07c789a08867c which reference the
blueprint URL as an explanation of why the change is being made - when
the link is broken reviewers have no context that lets them evaluate
the change.

To prevent this being a problem, I've added a note to template.rst
explaining that the blueprint should be created early, and have a
pointer to the change so that reviewers can follow the progress of the
spec.

This change is not itself a spec; it's a change to the process of
creating specs; but I feel as though the same approval process we use
for specs would make sense to use for changing the we suggest creating
specs.

Change-Id: I57bf5e0d73c63120259973515ea26593a2776ba2

commit_message:
Add Rally to networking-ovn

This adds the needed infrastructure to connect networking-ovn
with Rally benchmarking.
A relevant job will be defined to run Neutron with OVN with
the ovn.yaml jobs.
It is easy to defined OVN specific plugins and change the
scenarios run by Rally for OVN using the added files in this
patch.

Change-Id: I7c6a518ba8fb01725cb7a32f5e62062afc16f632

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 18:52:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/library.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/test_library.py'], 'message': 'NetApp: Cleanup if E-Series volume create fails

The creation of a volume may fail in such a manner
that a volume in a partial state has been created.
When Openstack comes back re-attempting the creation
operation it fails because the partial volume with
the name already exists.

Solution: When there is a failure creating a volume,
check if a partial volume was created and delete it
so any retry will be successful and the storage device
does not contain any dead volumes.

Closes-Bug: 1506940
Change-Id: Id93527a4cab314f27a13d8c08b772fed538d1092
(cherry picked from commit a4bcb1e11bf48207c81e42ba3b9c96f5e13d3ef6)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Cleanup if E-Series volume create fails

The creation of a volume may fail in such a manner
that a volume in a partial state has been created.
When Openstack comes back re-attempting the creation
operation it fails because the partial volume with
the name already exists.

Solution: When there is a failure creating a volume,
check if a partial volume was created and delete it
so any retry will be successful and the storage device
does not contain any dead volumes.

Closes-Bug: 1506940
Change-Id: Id93527a4cab314f27a13d8c08b772fed538d1092
(cherry picked from commit a4bcb1e11bf48207c81e42ba3b9c96f5e13d3ef6)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-22 20:03:39.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ironic-agent/source-repository-ironic-agent', 'elements/ironic-agent/environment.d/01-ironic-agent.sh'], 'message': "Use ironic-agent for source-repositories

I recently built a ramdisk for IPA and was confused by
the fact that the source-repositories name did not
match the element name. (this is a convention,
confusing when they don't match but certainly not
required).

This patch makes it so you can use DIB_REPOREF_ironic_agent to
customize the IPA ramdisk sources when building ramdisks.

For backwards compat if DIB_REPOREF_agent is set it automatically
sets the new DIB_REPOREF_ironic_agent to that value as well.

Change-Id: I082d989d0d85601f5984dc7c3767b8d66a3d5438
"}]
commit_message:
Use ironic-agent for source-repositories

I recently built a ramdisk for IPA and was confused by
the fact that the source-repositories name did not
match the element name. (this is a convention,
confusing when they don't match but certainly not
required).

This patch makes it so you can use DIB_REPOREF_ironic_agent to
customize the IPA ramdisk sources when building ramdisks.

For backwards compat if DIB_REPOREF_agent is set it automatically
sets the new DIB_REPOREF_ironic_agent to that value as well.

Change-Id: I082d989d0d85601f5984dc7c3767b8d66a3d5438

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 18:11:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Fix delete quota of subprojects

This patch aims to fix the bug in which cinder raises
an error when performing a delete quota operation in
a subproject.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a project A in keystone (e.g openstack project create A);
- Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent (e.g openstack
  project create B --property parent_id=<id of project A>);
- Update the quota value of A (e.g. openstack quota set
  <id of project A> --volume 5)
- Update the quota value of B (e.g. openstack quota set
  <id of project B> --volume 2)
- Try to delete the quota of B (e.g. cinder quota-delete
  <id of project B>)

Change-Id: Id1a749433c3679f1b2adf87ea0a280366c5e4a15
Closes-bug: #1496058
(cherry picked from commit 9a668a0a48135c423a4deda23bb161f6b917ac39)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix delete quota of subprojects

This patch aims to fix the bug in which cinder raises
an error when performing a delete quota operation in
a subproject.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a project A in keystone (e.g openstack project create A);
- Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent (e.g openstack
  project create B --property parent_id=<id of project A>);
- Update the quota value of A (e.g. openstack quota set
  <id of project A> --volume 5)
- Update the quota value of B (e.g. openstack quota set
  <id of project B> --volume 2)
- Try to delete the quota of B (e.g. cinder quota-delete
  <id of project B>)

Change-Id: Id1a749433c3679f1b2adf87ea0a280366c5e4a15
Closes-bug: #1496058
(cherry picked from commit 9a668a0a48135c423a4deda23bb161f6b917ac39)

commit_message:
Update router interface add/delete for ovsdb ovn-nb schema change

The latest ovsdb schema change [1] enables us to use lrouter port
name as router-port option in corresponding lswitch port. This
change is to update the logic accordingly. With this change the
two operations, adding lrouter port and updating peering lswitch
port are combined to a single transaction.

[1] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/0000744721bab30bd0db538fb3bc412137d5249f

Closes-bug: 1522540

Change-Id: I6a9f1328e8f6a7cb060dc377e14e3cdf6f014bb9

commit_message:
Refactor OVS-agent tunnel config validate

This change transforms validate_local_ip into a sub-method of
validate_tunnel_config and raises directly SystemExit instead of
indirectly.

Since os.path.join() is OS-dependent, it should not be used for creating
URLs. This patch replaces the use of os.path.join() in
nova/api/openstack with common.url_join(), which uses the more correct
"/".join(), while preserving the behavior of removing duplicate slashes
inside the URL and adding a trailing slash with an empty final element.
It also adds some tests to ensure that the generate_href() method in
nova/api/openstack/compute/views/versions.py works after the refactoring
to use common.url_join()

Closes-Bug: 1489627
Change-Id: I32948dd1fcf0839b34e446d9e4b08f9c39d17c8f
'}]
commit_message:
Replace os.path.join() for URLs

Since os.path.join() is OS-dependent, it should not be used for creating
URLs. This patch replaces the use of os.path.join() in
nova/api/openstack with common.url_join(), which uses the more correct
"/".join(), while preserving the behavior of removing duplicate slashes
inside the URL and adding a trailing slash with an empty final element.
It also adds some tests to ensure that the generate_href() method in
nova/api/openstack/compute/views/versions.py works after the refactoring
to use common.url_join()

Closes-Bug: 1489627
Change-Id: I32948dd1fcf0839b34e446d9e4b08f9c39d17c8f

commit_message:
Fixes TLS processing in the rest driver

The rest driver was not using updated cert utils to
handle processing of TLS certificates and would cause failures.

Also updates build_pem to be py34 compliant.

Change-Id: I05db39ff673083649735434f8e4cc710086ffd54
Closes-Bug: #1507723
(cherry picked from commit I05db39ff673083649735434f8e4cc710086ffd54)

subject: Checks percent_of_overlap when one boundary is set
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-04 09:18:06.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/test_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/carbonara.py'], 'message': "Checks percent_of_overlap when one boundary is set

Aggregation across metrics have different behavior depending
on if boundary are set and if needed_percent_of_overlap is set.

If boundaries are not set, Carbonara makes the aggregation only with points
at timestamp present in all timeseries.

But when boundaries are set, Carbonara expects that we have certain
percent of timestamps common between timeseries, this percent is controlled
by needed_percent_of_overlap (defaulted with 100%).

This change fixes a weird behavior when only one boundary is set,
the needed_percent_of_overlap wasn't checked.

Change-Id: Ifc85a9004e864d14d42fd482ec144e4d27dd615b
Closes-bug: #1522434
"}]
commit_message:
Checks percent_of_overlap when one boundary is set

Aggregation across metrics have different behavior depending
on if boundary are set and if needed_percent_of_overlap is set.

If boundaries are not set, Carbonara makes the aggregation only with points
at timestamp present in all timeseries.

But when boundaries are set, Carbonara expects that we have certain
percent of timestamps common between timeseries, this percent is controlled
by needed_percent_of_overlap (defaulted with 100%).

This change fixes a weird behavior when only one boundary is set,
the needed_percent_of_overlap wasn't checked.

Change-Id: Ifc85a9004e864d14d42fd482ec144e4d27dd615b
Closes-bug: #1522434

commit_message:
Remove Neutron FWaaS static example configuration files

Oslo config generator was introduced in patch [1] to
automatically generate the sample Neutron FWaaS configuration
files.

This patch removes the static example configuration files from
the repository as they are now redundant.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/251974/

DocImpact: Update the docs that FWaaS no longer includes static example
configuration files. Instead, use tools/generate_config_file_samples.sh
to generate them and the files generated now end with .sample extension.

Change-Id: I31be3295606ba25929e9af9f40a035ff2b615234
Partially-Implements: blueprint autogen-neutron-conf-file
Partial-bug: #1199963
Depends-On: Ic8208850a27408c8fbeed80ecdb43345aa7dfaa4

subject: Block oslo.messaging 3.1.0 since it breaks Ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-09 17:07:11.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Block oslo.messaging 3.1.0 since it breaks Ironic

oslo.messaging change I21d76abf1c30b9e89cb8a6c20d1c0cc79cd83a3f was
released in 3.1.0 and due to debtcollector bug 1520397 it breaks Ironic
loading it's request context serializer.

That was worked around in Ironic on master (mitaka) in commit
37d36f1536944de38a0f7a726e625b893088e1be but that doesn't fix Ironic in
stable/liberty, and we aren't going to backport that workaround to
stable/liberty.

So we need to fix oslo.messaging (either revert the deprecation change
or remove the usage of debtcollector) and release a fix there to fix
stable/liberty, but we still have to block the broken 3.1.0 release.

Related-Bug: #1524041

Change-Id: I3c5a9851ada30b6d7470113014b542b550a4ae8b
"}]
commit_message:
Block oslo.messaging 3.1.0 since it breaks Ironic

oslo.messaging change I21d76abf1c30b9e89cb8a6c20d1c0cc79cd83a3f was
released in 3.1.0 and due to debtcollector bug 1520397 it breaks Ironic
loading it's request context serializer.

That was worked around in Ironic on master (mitaka) in commit
37d36f1536944de38a0f7a726e625b893088e1be but that doesn't fix Ironic in
stable/liberty, and we aren't going to backport that workaround to
stable/liberty.

So we need to fix oslo.messaging (either revert the deprecation change
or remove the usage of debtcollector) and release a fix there to fix
stable/liberty, but we still have to block the broken 3.1.0 release.

Related-Bug: #1524041

Change-Id: I3c5a9851ada30b6d7470113014b542b550a4ae8b

subject: Add docker_images_redhat.yaml build-images file
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-22 15:06:03.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/docker_images_redhat.yaml'], 'message': 'Add docker_images_redhat.yaml build-images file

This patch adds a file to help build the heat docker "agent"
base image. We intend to use an image like this to help provision
a docker atomic host for TripleO. It should allow us to
run os-collect-config, various plugins, among other things.

Building this image with DIB is a really handy way to tap
into existing elements for TripleO which already support
the things we need. The downside is that the generated
image is going to be a base image... so there may still
be a case for building a similar image with Dockerfile's
as well. Still... having the the capability to work
with existing elements should significantly speed
up development because we can make use of more robust
elements like source-repositories, etc.

Because of how the docker base element works (and isn't a full
operating system) have had to define elements like yum, and
redhat-common within this config file. As such it is Red Hat
specific.

We also exclude the 'base' element to keep things a bit smaller.

Change-Id: I195c0ef8b844a5fd28a1f4ba465d975787775734
'}]
commit_message:
Add docker_images_redhat.yaml build-images file

This patch adds a file to help build the heat docker "agent"
base image. We intend to use an image like this to help provision
a docker atomic host for TripleO. It should allow us to
run os-collect-config, various plugins, among other things.

Building this image with DIB is a really handy way to tap
into existing elements for TripleO which already support
the things we need. The downside is that the generated
image is going to be a base image... so there may still
be a case for building a similar image with Dockerfile's
as well. Still... having the the capability to work
with existing elements should significantly speed
up development because we can make use of more robust
elements like source-repositories, etc.

Because of how the docker base element works (and isn't a full
operating system) have had to define elements like yum, and
redhat-common within this config file. As such it is Red Hat
specific.

We also exclude the 'base' element to keep things a bit smaller.

Change-Id: I195c0ef8b844a5fd28a1f4ba465d975787775734

commit_message:
Add support for generic controller validations

This patch wires in support for a generic controller validations
via a shell script.

Use of this requires a new heat-config-script element in order
to actually execute the shell script on the node via os-refresh-config.

Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib6f1153f8c2b857c1b2b5c9172a9836da70fe0ce

commit_message:
Stop checking if listener exists when uploading cert

The cert is being uplaoded in the flow BEFORE a listener is being
created. So creating a TLS load balancer will always result in an
error. This removes that check.

Closes-Bug: 1507723

Change-Id: If8d6de33ef7a4e71bdf80115da889da6f0535736
(cherry picked from commit If8d6de33ef7a4e71bdf80115da889da6f0535736)

commit_message:
Add class B3 and an example for C1 to the taxonomy

Be more explicit that OSSA does not cover vulnerabilities in
experimental features, backends and drivers by adding a new class B3
for these in the taxonomy. Also clarify that vulnerabilities relying
on UUID guessing are considered impractical, as an example for class
C1.

Change-Id: Ie73dfb0358913e6bdfeba56e6105f8156382d042

subject: add 'tempest' in puppet-openstack-integration jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 20:02:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "add 'tempest' in puppet-openstack-integration jobs

To have the puppet integration jobs part of Health [1] project, we want
logstash about to read subunit-files.
So we need to rename the jobs to match this job filter:
job-filter: '.*(tempest|grenade)-dsvm.*'

That way, we will be able to see the subunit results on [1].
Puppet group already did the necessary to prepare the subunit files, we
just miss this patch to actually rename the jobs.

[1] http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/

Change-Id: Ia41489a913d2adfc00b5f0d9177d1e810e95eec8
"}]
commit_message:
add 'tempest' in puppet-openstack-integration jobs

To have the puppet integration jobs part of Health [1] project, we want
logstash about to read subunit-files.
So we need to rename the jobs to match this job filter:
job-filter: '.*(tempest|grenade)-dsvm.*'

That way, we will be able to see the subunit results on [1].
Puppet group already did the necessary to prepare the subunit files, we
just miss this patch to actually rename the jobs.

[1] http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/

Change-Id: Ia41489a913d2adfc00b5f0d9177d1e810e95eec8

subject: test requirements with grenade multinode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-09 16:26:04.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'test requirements with grenade multinode

We only have a single voting multinode job, which is the grenade
partial upgrade job. Things like backportability of objects, and
actually going across a network get tested here in ways that no other
job tests. We should also use this test for requirements.

Change-Id: I9e6ff2e79ab1a59b7d1e4661b2f2030d8e453581
'}]
commit_message:
test requirements with grenade multinode

We only have a single voting multinode job, which is the grenade
partial upgrade job. Things like backportability of objects, and
actually going across a network get tested here in ways that no other
job tests. We should also use this test for requirements.

Change-Id: I9e6ff2e79ab1a59b7d1e4661b2f2030d8e453581
